Pero no se desespera, ya que recibe el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en una mina y recibe un sueldo fijo. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “productoras agrícolas las emprendedoras” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Yesenia, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos de habas.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 36, is an enterprising woman living with Rubén, her husband of 11 years.  They have three children together they care for in their own house.  As president of her association, she’s always responsible in everything she does.  

Her life has been tied to agriculture and animal husbandry; they are her source of income to this day.  When she formed her family alongside her husband they decided to intensify this activity growing mainly potatoes, olluco [Andean tuber] and lima beans as well as alfalfa for the cattle they have; they own two bulls and a donkey that's a beast of burden.

When harvest time arrives, she’s able to see the fruits of her hard work when she succeeds in selling her food crops for a good price.  There are seasons when market prices are good but there are also others when market prices are not too favorable.  However, she always continues forward because she can also rely on the animal sales she does.  She does not despair because she gets support from her husband who works in a mine and earns a steady salary.

She’s a member of the “Productores Agrícolas Las Emprendedoras” communal bank and this is the 10th MFP loan.  She is grateful for the financial support she’s granted regularly.  Now she has the means of improving her business.  She promises to be punctual with her payments because he’s been taught to be responsible.  Yesenia will use the requested money to buy organic manure to spread among her lima bean crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Azarius

texts.en:
Azarius is a sixty year old married man with four children hailing from Kasese, Uganda.  Forty years ago, he decided to venture into commercial farming.  He started on a small scale, but he is now one of the model farmers in the village.  

With the income earned, he was able to pay school fees for his children.  Two of them have degrees now, and he has also built a semipermanent house.  His major challenge is unpredictable weather changes.  His dream is to construct a permanent house and to buy more land for farming.

Azarius intends to use the loan facility to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Nanzaddorj

texts.en:
Mr. Nanzaddorj is a 54-year-old widower with three daughters and two sons living in a ger (traditional felt housing), in Tosontsengel, Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife has died last month. 

He started his business of manufacturing consumer products out of recyclable metals in 2002. He produces stacks, stoves, and metal sinks by using dumped or broken metals and scrap metals. He produces high-quality, low-priced products because inventory of products is a lot cheaper and available everywhere. Customers like his products better than others. 

In 2010, he also started planting vegetables in a garden and sells during the winter when the price is the highest of the year. He also pays his daughter's university tuition from his profit. 

He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to build a storage pit for a reserve of harvested vegetables for his family and to sell during winter. 

He is a hardworking, talented, and modest man who says that, "I need to work harder than ever to let my children grow healthy, educated and well-prepared for life, since all the responsibilities (are) on me now."

loans.use: to build a storage pit for a reserve of harvested vegetables for his family and to sell during winter.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Mari

texts.es: Nancy, de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Deysi y Yareli a las que cuida en su casa propia. Su principal trabajo es el mantenimiento de sus animales a los que cría con mucha dedicación, posee varias cabezas de ganado ovino, los que mantiene en las estancias, ya que no tiene prohibido tenerlos en su casa, por el espacio que ocuparían. Por ello constantemente los visita, ya que son cuidados por pastores a los que paga mensualmente. Además de dedicarse a la agricultura, pero solo en temporadas de sembríos, por ejemplo tiene habas y papa, que muy pronto cosechará, está segura de obtener buenos ingresos pues sus sembríos, se encuentran saludables y creciendo sin dificultad. Asimismo por las noches se dedica a cuidar el pequeño hospital de su pueblo, donde le pagan un sueldo mensual, por su parte siempre se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, ya que por las tardes cocina en el comedor. De esa manera puede mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante por ella misma. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “productoras agrícolas las emprendedoras” y este es el segundocrédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable. Nancy, invertirá el dinero en la compra de medicinas para dosificar y mantener a sus animales con vitaminas y calcios para que crezcan sanos y saludables.
texts.en:
Nancy, 41, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her two children, Deysi and Yareli, who she cares for in her own house.  Her main work is caring for her animals that she raises with much dedication.  She owns several head of sheep that she keeps on farm estates because it’s prohibited to keep them at home because of the space they’d take up.  Because of this, she visits them constantly while they are being cared for by shepherds she pays monthly.  In addition, she works in agriculture but only during the planting season.  For example, she has lima beans and potatoes that will be harvested soon.  She’s sure to earn good income because her crops are healthy and growing problem-free.  At nights, she works caring for her town’s small hospital earning a monthly salary.  She’s always been noted for being a very enterprising woman; in the afternoons she cooks in the cafeteria.

She’s a member of the “Productores Agrícolas Las Emprendedoras” communal bank and this is the 2nd MFP loan.  She is grateful for the financial support she’s constantly being given.  Now she has the means to improve her business.  She promises to be punctual with her payments since she’s been taught to be responsible.  Nancy will use the money to buy medicine to treat her animals with vitamins and calcium so that they will grow and develop in a healthy way.

loans.use: to buy veterinary medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers to clear her coffee farm.

loans.name: Maria Jacquelin

texts.es: María tiene 38 años de edad vive en el norte de Guayaquil en un zona llamada las Orquídea. Es soltera . María siempre le ha gustado comprar productos cosméticos para su uso personal, pero nunca había pensado en vender  productos  cosméticos. Fue entonces que una amiga de María que vende cosméticos la invito a que sea parte de una empresa de cosméticos llamada  AVON. En la actualidad ella ya tiene 2 años trabajando con el negocio de venta de productos de cosméticos por catálogos. La forma de trabajo es recorrer diversos lugares de la ciudad ofertando los productos entre amigos y conocidos. María por el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en cuanto a la delincuencia y espera poder continuar de esta manera. Con el crédito piensa comprar artículos de belleza como labiales, sombras, perfumes, cremas etc. Su sueño es poder  comprar una vitrina donde pueda exhibir sus productos en su casa.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old, single, and lives in an area called Las Orquídeas, which is north of Guayaquil. She always enjoyed buying cosmetics for her own personal use, but she never would have believed that she would be selling them. A friend of hers who sells cosmetics invited her to become part of the cosmetics company Avon.

María has been selling cosmetics through catalogs for two years. Her work requires her to travel to different parts of the city so that she can offer her products to friends and acquaintances. At the moment, María does not have to deal with any problems such as crime, and she hopes that she can continue in this manner. With this loan, she plans to buy beauty products such as lipsticks, eye shadows, perfumes, crèmes, and other items. Her dream is to buy a display cabinet so that she can exhibit her products in her home.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, eye shadows, perfumes, crèmes, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana desde que recibió su credikiva, su negocio cambió en un 100%, porque compró productos químicos, naturales y veterinarios con los cuales aumentó sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará propolio zarzaparrilla miel de abeja, escoba, purgante, aceite relajante jabón,  ceras y escencias. Su sueño es tener su negocio bien acondicionado y expandirlo para tener mayor productividad: A los financiadores de Kiva ella quiere  " Agradecerles, por la oportunidad que me brindaron de poder seguir adelante en mi nehgocio".
texts.en: Upon receiving her Kiva loan, Eliana changed her business 100% because she bought chemical, natural and veterinary products to increase her sales.  She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy bee propolis, sarsaparilla, honey, ‘escoba’ [used to ease menstrual cramps], laxative, relaxation oils, soap, waxes and essences.  Her dream is to have a well-stocked business and to expand it to increase productivity.  She wants to say the following to Kiva lenders: “I want to thank you for the opportunity you’ve given me to be able to continue forward with my business.”

loans.use: to buy natural remedies.

loans.name: La Esperanza Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la esperanza de futuro  y se ubica en una localidad llamad Benito Juárez  y que esta a una hora de copaínala e, e n donde celebran la fiesta de san Felipe.
 Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Marta, ella es casada  con el  señor Genaro con quien procreo  dos hijos quien uno ya está fuera de su responsabilidad y uno aun vive con ello.

 Ella  se dedica a su hogar y solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de quesos para luego venderlo fuera de su localidad a un precio que le da un buen resultado en esta actividad lleva unos años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  sus ingresos son mejores cada día.
 Inicio  con esta actividad  para apoyar a su  esposo con los ingreso de la casa y así poder apoyar a su hijo con la escuela.
 Lo que ella desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando y con el tiempo poder   tener una quesería más grande.
 Quien integran el grupo son: la señora  Beroisa  quien invertirá el préstamo en panadería y la señora María Deysi  en quesería.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Esperanza de Futuro” (The Hope of Future) and it’s located in a community called Benito Juárez that’s an hour from Copainalá where the feast of Saint Philip is celebrated.  The person who was interviewed is Marta.  She’s married to Genaro and they have two children, one who is no longer dependent on them and one who still lives at home.

She’s a housewife and requested the loan to buy cheese to resell outside her community at a price that will produce good profits.  She’s been in this activity for some years now and comments that she does well because her income improves every day.  She started this activity to help her husband with household income and to be able to support her son’s schooling.  What she wants from this small business is to continue working and in time have a larger cheese store.

The other group members are: Berosia, who will invest the loan in her bakery and María Deysi who will invest it in cheese.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Marvin  Manuel

texts.es:
Marvin, originario de León, casado, de oficio comerciante, él es dueño de un pequeño restaurante turístico ubicado al orilla de la playa. Su primer crédito Kiva le permitió surtir durante la época de verano de productos tales como mariscos, gaseosas y jugos.  
La época de noviembre y diciembre son meses muy buenos para los negocios comerciales, se llenan de muchos turistas y familia que llegan a pasar vacaciones, él requiere comprar gaseosas, bebidas para cocteles , cervezas, refrescos naturales , sillas y mesas plásticas  que es para lo cual está solicitando financiamiento. Su objetivo es ir mejorando las condiciones de su restaurante, brindarle un servicio de calidad a su clientela y se sientan a gusto de querer regresar.
texts.en:
Marvin is married and originally from León. He is the owner of a small tourist restaurant that is located along the beach. His first Kiva loan enabled him to stock up on supplies for the winter season such as seafood, sodas, and juices.

November and December are very good months for businesses since many tourists and their families come here to spend their vacations. Marvin needs to buy sodas, beverages for cocktails, beer, natural soft drinks, and plastic tables and chairs. For this reason, he is requesting a loan.

His goal is to improve the conditions in his restaurant. This will help him provide quality service to his customers so that they will want to return.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beverages for cocktails, beer, natural soft drinks, and plastic tables and chairs.

loans.name: Las Azucenas De Pueblo Nuevo Group

texts.es: Jarintzi tiene 24 años de edad es soltera y es maestra de primaria en una comunidad indígena, ella dice “ me gusta el relacionarme con la gente enseñar a los niños cosas buenas e innovadoras, me gusta trabajar con la gente de comunidad por que las personas son responsables y aunque no tienen estudio son personas respetuosas y amables” ella pertenece al grupo llamado Las Azucenas de Pueblo Nuevo” dice que le decidieron poner ese nombre al grupo por que en la casa donde se reúnen la señora tiene  muchas flores llamadas así y lo de pueblo nuevo por que así se llama su localidad. Dice que aparte de trabajar como maestra por las mañanas por la tarde vende zapato por catalogo, ropa, cosméticos de diferentes marcas a sus compañeras de trabajo y a sus conocidas, dice que empezó con este negocio para ayudarle a sus padres cuando ella era estudiante ya que estudiaba en una ciudad llamada Morelia que es la capital del estado de Michoacán y para apoyar a sus papas con los gastos de sus libros y materiales que ocupaba decidió empezar su propio negocio. Ella surte sus productos en diferentes distribuidoras autorizadas de zapato y ropa y cosméticos. Las otras siete integrantes del grupo son Alma, Gabriela, Marisela, Fabiola, María Isabel, Irma y Adelina ellas invertirán en sus negocios en una pastelería ya que comprara materia prima para hacer sus pasteles y postres, para la compra de dulces para vender, artículos  para tienda de abarrotes, para la compra de pollo vivo para después venderlos por kilos destazado y para surtir pedidos de cosméticos, ropa y zapatos para vender.
texts.en:
Jarintzi, 24, is single and teaches elementary school in an indigenous community.  She says:  “I like to relate to people and teach new and innovative things to children.  I like working with community people because they are responsible and even though they have no formal schooling they are respectful and kind people.”  She’s a member of a group called “Las Azucenas de Pueblo Nuevo” (Pueblo Nuevo Easter Lilies).  She says they decided on this name because the lady of the house they meet in has many of these flowers and the ‘Pueblo Nuevo’ part is because that’s the name of their location.

She says that besides working mornings as a teacher, she also sells shoes, clothes and various brand cosmetics via catalogue in the afternoon.  She says she started this business to help her parents when she was a student since she studied in a city called Morelia which is the capital of the state of Michoacán and to help her parents pay for her books and other supplies she needed she decided to start her own business.  She stocks up on merchandise at various authorized shoe, clothes and cosmetics distributors.

The other seven group members are: Alma, Gabriela, Marisela, Fabiola, María Isabel, Irma and Adelina.  They will invest in their businesses: to buy raw materials to make cakes and pastries in a bakery, to buy candy to sell, to buy stock merchandise for a grocery store, to buy live chickens to then sell butchered by the kilogram and to stock up to fill cosmetics, shoes and clothing orders to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Sumiyadorj

texts.en:
Sumiyadorj, 25, lives with his wife and a 2-year-old only son in his wooden house in Kherlen, the third largest city in Mongolia. His wife doesn’t have a job so looks after their child. Sumiyadorj has been working as an engineman for 7 years in a government company which distributes electricity through the eastern province of Mongolia. 

Sumiyadorj bought his house by leasing it for ten years in 2005. This July he fully paid-off the lease. In winter his house gets very cold and he uses a large amount coal to heat the house. When he is at his job, his wife and son are left in the house the whole day. Sumiyadorj said that after leaving his family in the cold house, he can't concentrate on what he is doing. For this reason, before the winter he has a plan to insulate the house by using energy-saving materials like glass-wool, double-glazed windows and bricks. 

Sumiyadorj started insulating his house but in the middle of the job, his materials were used up. So Sumiyadorj is asking 2,500,000 MNT loan to complete his house insulation to overcome the cold winter days and to cut the usage of coal.

loans.use: to complete his house insulation to overcome the cold winter days and to cut the usage of coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas to resell.

loans.name: Essam

texts.en: Essam, 44 years old, is a married guy. He has three kids and their ages are 16, 12, and 6 years old. Essam has a housewares shop and he wants to increase the quantity he has and have more variety in what he sells. So now he has applied for this loan to do that.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of housewares he has

loans.name: Fawzia

texts.en: Fawzia is a conservative woman, and for that reason, she asked her son Ahmad to take her place in the photo. Fawzia, 48 years old, is a housewife and a mother of 5 children. She is helping in supporting the family by working at her mini-market that serves a lot of families in the neighborhood. Her son Ahmad helps her so she can take a break and rest during the day. Now Fawzia wants to bring more goods to the store, and for that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to bring more goods for the store

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Don Elías es un hombre muy trabajador es la primera vez que estará como cliente de la institución, tiene 42 años de edad estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria esta casado con la señora Nicolasa y juntos han formado una familia con cuatro niños que aun son sus dependientes  se dedica a la venta de platicos desde hace 7 años platica que inicio su actividad desde muy temprana edad porque ayudaba en el negocio de sus tíos quien trabajaba para ellos Don Elías comenta “Fue como inicie la venta de almohadas ranchando y gritando en las calles pero era muy difícil porque yo tenía que cargar varas almohadas en los hombros era complicado trabajar así entonces fue como regrese a la venta de platicos poco a poco fue ganando lugares tianguis pero ahora ya tengo un lugar establecido” Don Elías platica que no tiene ninguna dificultad solo que hace un poquito de dinero para poder comprar mas mercancía porque le gustaría crecer mas en su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y para que todos sus hijos terminen una carrera. Por lo que un crédito de la institución y kiva será de gran ayuda para cumplir sus metas. Don Elías también se dedica a la venta de a domicilio inicio su actividad porque cercas de donde vive se abrió una gasera y fue invitado por su primo para trabajar como repartidor de gas.
texts.en:
Elías is a hard-working man and this is the first time he will be a client at the institution.  He is forty-two years old and studied until his third year in high school.  He is married to Nicolasa and together they have formed a family with four children, all of which are still their dependents.  

He has made a living selling plastic products for the past seven years.  He says that he began working from a very early age because he helped with his uncles' business; he worked for them.  

Elías says, "I began in the sale of pillows and cushions, wandering and yelling in the streets, but it was very difficult because I had to carry multiple pillows on my shoulders.  It was complicated to work like that so I returned to the sale of plastic products.  Little by little I was winning spots to sell at open-air markets, but now I have an established place."  

Elías says that he does not have any problems.  He makes a little bit of money to be able to buy more merchandise.  He would like to grow his business to better the quality of life for his family, and so that all of his children complete their career studies.  

A loan from the institution and Kiva will be a great help in order to accomplish his goals.  

Elías also makes a living selling door-to-door; he began this activity because he was invited by his cousin to also work as a gas distributor close to where he lives.

loans.use: to buy plastic products used for household cleaning.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Don Andrés un hombre siempre bien ocupado por sus labres en sus diferentes negocios, pero eso si siempre muy alegre siempre tiene una ocurrencia para hacernos reir. Don Andrés tiene 54 años de edad esta casado con la señora Lurdes desde hace ya  varios años juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos, Don Andrés tiene una Ferretería, casa de materiales, papelería y además un camión el cual lo destina para viajes que tenga que hacer, esta vez esta esta solicitando un crédito para comprar material para construccion y mas cosas de ferretería como son tubos, cables tornillos, abrazaderas etc. Platica que su negocio lo inicio porque ya tenia experiencia y el lugar destinado para poner sus negocios, la dificultad que presenta es cuando da créditos  a sus vecinos y muchas veces ya no le pagan y eso para Don Andrés es una pérdida económica muy grande. Aunque comenta que no a cualquiera le da crédito por lo general siempre les da crédito a las personas que conoce. Aunque Don Andrés ha sido siempre muy trabajador tiene la idea que en los tiempos en que vivimos no podemos aspirar a mucho ya que la economía no está muy bien pero si tiene metas con su Familia tiene un hijo que esta por graduarse como veterinario y quieren poder una granja de animales donde el mismo sepa cuidarlos y al mismo pueda seguir preparándose con mas ganas.
texts.en:
Andrés is a man who is always very busy with his work in his different businesses.  However, he is always very happy, and he always has a witty remark to make us laugh.  Andrés, age 54, has been married to Lurdes for several years, and they are a family with four children.

Andrés has a store selling hardware, construction materials, and a stationery items.  He also has a truck, which is used for trips that he needs to make.

This time he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials and more things for his hardware business like tubes, cables, screws, and brackets, etc.  He says that he started his business because he already had experience and a place to put his businesses.  The difficulty that occurs is when he gives his neighbors credit.  Many times they do not pay him, and this is a very big financial loss for Andrés.  Even though he says that he does not give credit to just anybody, he generally gives credit to the people he knows.

Even though Andrés has always been very hard-working, he believes that during the times we are now living we cannot aspire to much because the economy is not very good.  However, he does have goals with his family.  He has a son who will soon graduate as a veterinarian.  They want to be able to have an animal farm where he, himself, knows how to take care of them.  At the same time he will continue getting ready very eagerly.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and more things for his hardware business like tubes, cables, screws, and brackets, etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru: Валентина торгует спортивной одеждой и имеет две торговых точки. Одна расположена в Торговом Центре "Башни" на 4-ом этаже, другая - на Центральном рынке. Валентина торгует  как женской так и мужской спортивной одеждой: спорт. штаны, костюмы, футболки, толстовки, майки. Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки зимнего товара: утепленных штанов, теплых футболок, и курток. Валентина - порядочная и честная клиентка, которая всегда во время выплачивает кредиты.
texts.en:
Valentina sells sporting clothes and has two sales points. One is located in the shopping center "Bashni" ("Tower"), on the fourth floor. The other is at the central market. 

Valentina sells both women's and men's sporting clothes: Sporting pants, track suits, t-shirts, hoodies and jerseys. 

Valentina requests a loan for the purchase of winter goods: Insulated pants, warm shirts and jackets. Valentina is a decent and honest client, who always pays back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase winter goods: Insulated pants and jackets

loans.name: El Pozito Comercio Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Pozito” se encuentra en una comunidad que se caracteriza por la siembra de nopales, es una comunidad muy bonita y grande sobretodo eso es muy grande, los integrantes del grupo son siete todas son mujeres ellas mismas eligieron el nombre de su grupo y platican que pusieron este nombre porque cercas de donde se reúnen se encuentra un pozito que lleva ya varios años en ese lugar. Las integrantes del grupo son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras todas y tienen una actividad productiva es por eso que están solicitando un crédito a la institución como por ejemplo las señoras María de Lourdes, Maricruz, María Juana, Ícela, compraran productos de Jarcería para su venta, mientras que Doña Julia comprara comales para su venta. Doña Natalia quien también forma parte del grupo es cliente desde hace ya varios años de la institución inicio solicitando un crédito pequeño para invertirle a su negocio de comales y playeras hasta la fecha  mantiene un crédito ya mas grande, platica que tienen 50 años de edad esta casada con el señor Remigio desde hace 25 años con el cual ha formado una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales ya solo uno es dependiente, Doña Natalia se dedica a la venta de comales y playeras en su negocio lleva ya 30 años e inicio el negocio porque quería ayudar a mi esposos con los gastos del hogar, conversando con la señora Natalia comento “Me gusta mucho vender ya que antes vendía ranchando por las calles ya sea en la comunidad, en otras comunidades, etc. Actualmente estamos vendiendo en la ciudad de México, mi única dificulta es cuando son temporadas de lluvia ya que por lo normal no se vende y llueve todo el día y como no tengo un puesto establecido toda mi mercancía” sin embargo para Doña Natalia viene las mejores temporadas es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito a la intititucion y Kiva, la meta de Doña Natalia es ver a su hijo realizarse profesionalmente  en general todo el grupo esta muy agradecido por el apoyo y confianza de Vision Found y Kiva por el crédito otorgado ya que será de gran ayuda para sus actividades productivas.
texts.en:
“El Pozito” Communal Bank is located in a community that is known for its cultivation of “nopales” (cactus). It is a very pretty and large community; above all it is very large. There are seven members in the bank and all are women. They themselves chose the name of their group and they say they chose this name because there is a "pozito" or small pool near where they meet, which has been there for several years. 

The members of the bank are all very hardworking and enterprising people with productive businesses. Thus they are requesting a loan from FRAC. They include, for example, Sras. Maria de Lourdes, Maricuz, Maria Juana, and Icela, who will purchase cleaning products to sell, while Doña Julia will buy ceramic hotplates to sell. 

Doña Natalia, who is also part of the group, has been a client of FRAC for several years and started by requesting a small loan to invest in her business selling hotplates and T-shirts. To date she has successfully had even larger loans.

She notes that she is 50 years old and has been married to her second husband, Sr. Remigio, for the past 25 years. They have four children, of whom only one is still dependent on them. Natalia has been selling hotplates and beachwear for 30 years and started the business because she wanted to help her husbands with household expenses. She says: “I enjoy selling very much because formerly I was a street vendor selling both in my own and neighboring communities, etc.  Nowadays, we are selling in the city of Mexico. My only difficulty is during the rainy seasons because usually one cannot sell when it rains all day and I don’t have an established stall with all of my merchandise.”  Nevertheless, the best seasons are yet to come for Natalia. Consequently she is requesting a loan from FRAC and Kiva.

Doña Natalia’s goal is to see her children become professionals. 

All of the members of the bank are very grateful for the support and confidence shown by World Vision International and Kiva with the loan granted to them because it will be a great help in their productive activities.

loans.use: to purchase ceramic hotplates to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Doña Esther es una mujer muy trabajadora desde muy temprano se levanta para poder iniciar a atender su negocio, ella vive en un municipio donde generalmente hay mucho trasporté se cuanta con los servicios necesarios Doña Esther tiene 41 años de edad es viuda tuvo cuatro hijos de los cuales dos aun son dependientes de ella, Doña Esther tiene une negocio de frutas y verduras no tiene ningún nombre, lleva ya con su negocio 24 años y lo inicio porque su esposo trabajaba en esto vendiendo la fruta y verduras y su esposo tenia registrado el negocio como “Jazmín” entonces así fue como Doña Esther aprendió de su negocio, Al parecer no presenta ninguna dificultad pero su meta es sacar adelante sus hijos que terminen de estudiar una carreara profesional, pero también le encantaría hacer crecer mas su negocio es por eso que solicito crédito para comprar frutas de temporada ya que esta es época en donde vende mas por las posadas que se realizan en México. Ella esta muy agradecida con la institución y con Kiva por el crédito ya que ha sido de gran ayuda para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esther is a hard-working woman. She wakes up very early and starts working. She lives in a municipality where there are a lot of transportation-related activities. She has all the services she needs.

Mrs. Esther is 41, she is a widow and has four children. Two of them still depend on her.

Mrs. Esther’s stall does not have a name. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for twenty-four years. She started with this business because her husband used to sell fruits and vegetables, in a stall called “Jazmín” and she learned from him.

She is not in need, but her goal is to help her children thrive and that they graduate from the university. She also wants to expand her business, and this is why she requested a loan for buying seasonal fruits. It is during this season when sales increase the most, because it is when the “posadas” [a traditional Christmas celebration] are celebrated in Mexico.

She really appreciates the help that the institute and Kiva have given her and her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es: El Grupo Sorpresa  esta integrado por cinco mujeres muy trabajadoras y que hacen lo posible para que sus familias tengan una mejor calidad de vida y un hombre, los integrantes son Doña Adelina, Juana, Juliana, Benita y Noé todos los integrantes han solicitado el crédito para invertirlo en borregos. El nombre del grupo lo eligió La señora Lety quien también forma parte del grupo platica que decidió ponerle este nombre al grupo ya que el día que la invitaron para solicitar crédito a la institución le llamo mucho la atención y para Doña Lety era una muy buena opción es por eso que fue de “Sorpresa” que llegaran a su casa a invitarla para solicitar crédito. Doña Lety como la dicen de cariño cuenta que tiene 38 años de edad esta casada con el señor José desde hace 19 años juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando,  la señora Lety paltica que se dedica a la crianza de borregos los compra desde pequeños los crece hasta cuando están grandes fuertes y gordos los vende a personas que se dedican hacer barbacoa, Doña Lety comenta “Entre mas grandes estén mis borregos mis ganancias serán mejor aunque muchas veces mi dificultad mas grandes es cuando enferman y enflacan mucho o llegan a morir ahí es la perdida total de mi inversión y la ganancia aunque gracias a la capacitación que recibimos por parte de la institución de cómo cuidar nuestros borregos me ayudo mucho ya que aprendí cosas que no sabia” Esta vez Doña Lety está solicitando el crédito para comprar mas borregos pastura y alimento para sus borregos, doña Lety comenta que le gusta mucho cuidar a sus borregos porque le enseño su mamá y mas ahora se ha convertido en una  un apoyo económico para su familia y que prueba de que sus ganancias le han ayudado mucho, es como ha mejorado su vivienda esta vez piensa poner el zaguán a su entrada, Doña Lety y el resto del grupo están muy agradecidos con la institución y Kiva por el crédito otorgado y todos sus servicios como la capacitación y la bonificación que es muy buena sonriendo Doña Lety comenta “A me la bonificación me servirá de mucho ya que con ese dinero voy a poder comprar el vestido de graduación y un regalito extra”
texts.en: The Sorpresa group is made up of 5 hard-working women, who do whatever is possible to provide their families with a better quality of life, and one man. The group members are Dona Adelina, Juana, Juliana, Benita and Noé; all of the members are applying for this loan to invest it in buying lambs. The group name was chosen by Lety, who is also part of the group. She says that they decided to use this name because the day that the institution called at the house to invite them to apply for their loan, she was very surprised by it and she thought that this was a good choice for a name. Dona Lety says that she is 38 years old and she has been married to Jose for 19 years. In the family that they have created together they have 4 children who are all currently studying. Lety says that she raises lambs to sell: she buys them when they are young and raises them until they are large, strong and fattened, then she sells them on to people who grill them to sell. Dona Lety says, 'The bigger my lambs get, the more money I will earn although often my greatest difficulties come when the animals get sick and lose a lot of weight, or even when they die and that means I lose my whole investment and earnings. However, thanks to the support provided by the institution, which tell us how to care for our lambs, I have had a lot of help and I have learned things that I never knew before'. This time Dona Lety is applying for this loan to buy grazing lambs and food to nourish them. She tells us that she likes caring for her lambs because her mother taught her how to do it and now she has been able to support her family economically,  which proves that her earnings have helped her a lot. She has used her earnings to improve her house; next she would like to build an entrance hall on to her home. Dona Lety and the rest of the group are very grateful to the institution and to Kiva for the loans that they grant and all the services they provide, such as the training and the discounts which are great, Dona Lety says while smiling, 'To me, the discounts are a great help as with the money that I save, I will be able to be buy her children's graduation dress and an extra little gift.'

loans.use: To buy lambs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and grocery items.

loans.name: Gs Luz Y Amor Group

texts.es:
La Señora Martha, se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de ropa de varón, de mujer edredones, ropa interior, maíz y frijoles, ella cuenta con mas 5 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio.
Doña Martha es una persona muy trabajadora, cuenta con  la clientela de la zona y a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, ella se a sabido ganar la clientela porque su manera de atenderlos es muy especial.
Doña Martha con el préstamo que reciba comprara ropa de varón, de mujer edredones, ropa interior, maíz y frijoles, esto le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y  una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
Doña Martha sueña con surtir su negocio y mejorar la fachada de su casa ya que donde ella vive faltan muchos servicios públicos.
Gicela se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, granos básicos, refrescos, en la comunidad donde ella habita y ambulante, desde hace 5 años.
Dixie su negocio es la venta de abarroteria, en una caseta ubicada en la calle principal de la comunidad donde ella vive, negocio que opera  desde hace 3 años contando con la clientela de la zona.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Martha’s a merchant.  Her main activity is selling clothes for men and women, comforters, underwear, corn and beans.  She has more than five years’ experience managing her business.  Martha is a very hardworking woman who has a local clientele and who has gotten ahead thanks to her business.  It’s been one of her main sources of income.  She’s succeeded in winning over customers thanks to the special service she provides.  

Martha will use the loan to buy clothes for men and women, comforters, underwear, corn and beans.  This will contribute to having a better business, to cover household expenses and provide better quality of life for her family.  Martha dreams with stocking her business and with improving the façade of her house since the area she lives in still lacks many public services.

Gloria has been selling cosmetics, basic grains and soft-drinks in the community she lives in for five years and Dixie has a grocery store located in a stand on the main street where she lives; her business has been in operation for three years and has a regular, local clientele.

Danli, El Paraíso, Honduras - October, 2012

loans.use: to buy clothes and grocery items.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.ru: Олег торгует велосипедами и запчастями к ним. Кредит понадобился для закупки партии  запчастей для велосипедов: цепей, спиц, а так же колес, и шин. Олег - порядочный и трудолюбивый, он никогда не опаздывает по выплатам, всегда вовремя выплачивает свои кредиты.
texts.en:
Oleg sells bicycles and spare parts for them. He needs a loan for the purchase of a batch of spare parts for bicycles: Chains, spokes as well as wheels and tires. 

Oleg is a decent and hardworking man, he is never late on payments and he always pays his loan back on time.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Kuña Aty Jeheca Group

texts.es:
El comité "Kuña Aty Jeheka"se originó a través de promociones que se hicieron en el barrio. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en forma conjunta, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa de comité de mujeres.
La Sra Sabina, es Presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica en la venta de leche, su día empieza desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que debe de acercar su productos a sus clientes para la hora del desayuno. Ella es muy sacrificada y por medio de su esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de leche en cantidad, ya que así podrá tener un buen stock y de esa forma cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kuña Aty Jeheka Communal Bank was formed through promotions that were made in the neighborhood.  All the members are from the same area, acquaintances and neighbors from the neighborhood.  The goal of each one is to work together, encourage a spirit of solidarity, and reach the highest level of the women's bank program.

Sabina is the president of the group.  She makes a living selling milk, and says her day begins very early because she has to get her products to her customers by breakfast.  She's very selfless and says only by working can one get ahead, and she wants to continue doing so.

She's requesting the loan to buy milk wholesale because that way she'll be able to have a good supply and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Neliberta

texts.es: La señora Neliberta vive en una comunidad muy tranquila donde lo que mas se cultiva es el maíz, la comunidad donde vive hay muchas personas muy amables Doña Neliberta es una persona muy sonriente es un muy joven tiene 48 años esta casada con el señor Alejandro desde hace 29 años juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando. La señora Neliberta se dedica a la crianza de bueyes y cerdos desde hace 1 año inicio su actividad porque quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con los gastos de la educación de sus hijos también porque desde pequeña veía que en su comunidad la mayoría de las personas tenían animales para vender, la señora Neliberta comenta que se animo ha solicitar un crédito a la institución porque necesitaba alimento para cerdos y bueyes ya es una de sus dificultades “Muchas veces no podemos comprar el alimento para mis animales sin embargo hay otras ocasiones en donde es imposible comprar el alimento ya que es muy caro” Y si Doña Neliberta no compra el alimento para sus animales no tendrá buenas ganancias ya que Ella los compra desde pequeños los crece y engorda durante varios meses dándoles de comer todas las mañanas, los limpia y les da agua. Espera hasta que sus animales estén grandes y gordos para poder venderlos entre más grandes y gordos sean los animales es mejor la ganancia. Doña Neliberta siempre trata de cuidar muy bien sus animales para que sus ganancias sean mejor ya a Doña Neliberta le gustaría que sus hijos terminaran sus carreras que están estudiando “Y si para eso tengo que seguir trabajando lo seguiré haciendo y mejorar la venta de mis animales, estoy muy agradecida con la institución y Kiva por el crédito otorgado ya que me servirá de mucho porque podre comprar mas alimento que me durara por algunos meses y tendré que preocuparme por eso”
texts.en:
Sra. Neliberta lives in a peaceful community where corn is the main crop that is grown. Many friendly people live in this community, including Doña Neliberta, who always has a youthful smile on her face. She is 48 years old and has been married to Sr. Alejandro for 29 years. Their family includes four children who are in school.

Sra. Neliberta has been raising oxen and pigs for one year. She started this activity because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and her children’s educational expenses. Since childhood, she has watched many people in her community raise animals so that they can sell them. Sra. Neliberta says that she is excited about requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad because she needs to feed her oxen and pigs since this one of her difficulties. “Many times we are not able to buy food for our animals because there have been several occasions when it has been impossible because the price of feed is very expensive,” she says. If Doña Neliberta is not able to buy feed for her animals, then she will not achieve good profits. She buys feed from the time the animals are young so that they can grow and gain weight over the course of several months. Neliberta feeds the animals every morning, cleans them, and gives them water. She hopes that her animals will become large and bulky so that they can be sold at the best price.

Doña Neliberta always cares for and treats her animals well so that she can obtain the most profit. She would like to see her children finish their degrees. Sra. Neliberta adds the following comments: “It is for this reason that I continue working hard and improving my animal sales. I am very grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for giving me this loan which will be of great help. I will be able to buy more feed over the next few months since this has been a worry of mine.”

loans.use: to buy pigs, oxen, and the appropriate animal feed.

location.town: San Isidro Boxipe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Peñitas Group

texts.es: El grupo peñitas se encuentra en una comunidad muy hermosa lo que caracteriza sus arboles grandes también por lo general hace siempre hace mucho frio siempre, el grupo está integrado por 11 personas las cuales son muy trabajadoras y responsables siempre tratan de estar muy puntuales con para cualquier situación que se tenga que hablar con su grupo el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque así se llama la comunidad donde pertenecen y al parecer está en la lengua mazahua, los integrantes del grupo han solicitado un nuevo crédito para invertir en sus actividades como Bibiana quien invertirá en juguetes para algodones, don andres comprar borregos para barbacoa, Doña Inés, Rosa y Guadalupe invertirán en pollos y guajolotes, Don Irineo y Adelina en la cosecha de sus hortalizas, Doña Martha en una tienda de abarrotes, Don Luis en su taxi y Doña María en sus cerditos Doña Juana  quien también forma parte del grupo platica que tiene 4 hijos no son mayores de edad y el mayor entro a la secundaria, tiene 13 años de casada y 32 años de edad, vive en casa prestada y su esposo trabaja, el lugar donde viven es en el barrio las Peñas en una comunidad que pertenece  al municipio de el Oro, México. Doña Juana se dedica a vender Toopers de plástico, tiene variedades en tamaños y modelos por lo regular siempre les vende a mujeres, es mercancía de buena calidad no es de marca pero si son durables, por ejemplo trae consigo salseras, loncheras, tortilleros, vasos, platos entre otras cosas, Doña Juana dice que en ocasiones si ve difícil terminar de vender sus plásticos ya que no todas las amas de casa se animan a comprar, comenta que la situación está muy difícil y ella con tal de vender y de ganar aunque sea poco deja las cosas más baratas pero no le gusta dejar las cosas fiadas ya que corre el riesgo de que algunas gentes no le paguen, también lo que se le ha hecho muy difícil es conseguir sus clientes, porque son gente que tal vez en un momento te compren y después de uno o dos meses te vuelven a comprar otra cosa diferente y en este momento doña Juana tiene sus clientes y por esa razón quiere comprar nueva mercancía y lo que le gusta que siempre que va por nueva mercancía hay nuevos modelos de toopers mas bonitos que los anteriores y eso significa que los puede terminar de vender, a doña Juana le conviene invertir por paquetes nos comenta que tiene más ganancias y es mejor para ella porque evita ir mas seguido por cosas, también su esposo le ayuda en ocasiones para poder vender mas rápido las cosas porque en su trabajo ofrece a sus amigos.
texts.en:
The “Peñitas” group is located in a very beautiful community characterized by its large trees and also because it’s usually always cold there.  The group has 11 members who are very hardworking and responsible and always try to be very punctual on any occasion when the group needs to be addressed for anything.  The group name was chosen because that’s the name of the community they belong to and apparently it’s in the Mazahua tongue.  The group members have requested a new loan to invest in their activities.

For example, Bibiana will invest in stuffed toys, Andrés in goats for barbeque, Inés, Rosa and Guadalupe in chickens and turkeys, Irineo and Adelina in their vegetable crops, Martha in her grocery store, Luis in his taxi and María in her piglets.

Juana who also forms part of this group relates that she has four children who are still minors; the oldest has just started secondary school.  She’s been married 13 years and she’s 32-years-old.  She lives in a borrowed house and her husband’s employed.  The place they live in is the Las Peñas neighborhood that belongs to El Oro, México.

Juana sells plastic containers in all sizes and shapes.  She usually sells to women.  It’s good quality merchandise, not brand-name but durable nonetheless.  For example, she carries sauce containers, lunch boxes, screw containers, drinking glasses and plates, among others.  Juana says that sometimes it’s difficult to sell all her plastic wares because not all housewives venture to buy.  She comments that the situation is very difficult and in order to sell and earn even a little profit she lowers her prices but does not like selling on credit because she runs the risk of some people not paying her.  It’s also been hard to acquire customers because people might buy something from you at the moment and then after a month or two perhaps buy something else and this is why Juana wants to have a good stock of new merchandise on hand for her customers.  There are newer, prettier styles of plastic ware than previous ones and this means that she will be able to sell them all.  It’s advantageous for Juana to invest in packages and she comments that profits are higher that way and better for her because she doesn’t have to go restock so often.  Her husband helps her occasionally to sell more quickly because he’ll sell to his friends at work.

loans.use: to buy plastic ware.

loans.name: Gs Los Higueros Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmen de 40 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus 3 hijos quienes viven en su casa de habitación, ubicada en la comunidad de la Higüeros, al sur de Honduras, dedicándose a su actividad que es: la venta de rosquillas, Hojaldras, tustacas, quesadillas en la comunidad donde ella vive y alrededores. 
Doña Carmen solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como  leña,  maíz, harinas  y azúcar que son los productos que ella necesita para realizar sus productos.
Doña Carmen con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir creciendo al igual que sus demás compañeras de grupo quienes se dedican al negocio de pulpería, y venta de tamales son Doña Liliana Y María ambas residentes en la comunidad delos Higüeros.
Doña Carmen su sueño es poder ir mejorando mas su casa de habitación.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old, and she lives with her spouse and their three children in their house, located in the Higüeros community in southern Honduras. She makes a living selling Honduran pastries: rosquillas (donuts), hojaldras (puff pastries), tustacas (cookies) and quesadillas (cheesecakes) in the community where she lives and their outskirts. 

Carmen requests this loan to buy products like firewood, corn, flour and sugar which are the products she needs to make her goods.  With the support of this loan, Carmen would like to continue investing in her business and keep it growing like the business of the other partners in her group who make a living in their general store and tamale sales. Her partners are Liliana and Maria who are both residents of the Higüeros community. Carmen's dream is to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, flour and sugar for their business

loans.name: Beatrice Bih

texts.en:
Beatrice is married and blessed with six children, four of them under fifteen years of age.  They live in a four room apartment in Mankon Bamenda in the Northwest Region of Cameroon.  She has faced some challenges in life, including the death of her first husband, which causes her to suffer with her children a lot, and inadequate capital to start up a business.  

With this loan, she plans to buy more water fufu (a dough-like food made by boiling casava) in bags.  She will also invest part of the loan in pig rearing.  She will buy piglets, feed for the pigs, and vaccines for the pigs.      

She believes that her business will succeed because she has regular customers who frequently buy water fufu from her, and demand is high for water fufu in the city of Bamenda, giving her a good market.  

Also, the demand for pork meat is high, giving her a ready market.  The pig droppings will serve as manure for the community, and the community with be supplied with quality water fufu.

With the profit from this loan, she with educate her children and provide all their basic needs.  She will also buy material for the renewal of her house.  She prefers to take a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates on loans and the education talks given at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy casava in bags and piglets for resale.

loans.name: Alan

texts.es:
Alan es un joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pareja y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos familiares, Alan no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Arquitectura que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones su pareja le cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para engreírlo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alan se dedica a la construcción, él es maestro de obras, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, Alan puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque se esfuerza mucho y tiene un gran deseo por salir adelante.
Alan se encuentra agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que él desea poder hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso de su hogar; de esta manera Alan tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones, las cuales brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar para su él y su familia, así pues Alan seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para cumplir su gran sueño de poder darle una mejor calidad de vida para sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Alan, 19, is a young man that lives in the city of Nazca together with his wife and their two small children. She loves them and they are his main reason to live. He is a kind person, hard-working and enthusiastic. Both him and his wife work hard in order to get ahead in life with their family. 

Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources and because he had to work in order to be able to pay for the expenses at home, Alan was not able to study architecture, which was his dream. He would have really liked to.

In his free time, he likes to watch educational programs on the TV and sometimes, his wife spoils him by cooking a delicious “chaufa” rice for him.

Alan works in the construction sector, with hard work and dedication. He is a general contractor and he starts working early in the morning. He works for approximately twelve hours and he believes that he gets good results because he is committed and has a strong will to succeed.

Alan appreciates the help given by Kiva lenders, because he will be able to make some home improvements, like whitewashing, painting and installing the floor. In this way, Alan will have a better house, which in turn will be safer and will improve his and his family’s well-being. Alan will continue to work to make his dream come true: to provide his little ones with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Abib

texts.en:
Abib, a 26-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda, has been selling salt for five years, and with the profits he has been able to pay school fees and provide other major basics for his family.

Abib, who has a demarcated well in the lake from which he extracts the salt, also buys from other miners. His major hardship is lack of proper protective equipment to use during extraction, thus exposing him to health hazards.

Abib is requesting this loan to buy salt to sell. His dreams are to acquire modern mining equipment and to process the salt to add value.

loans.use: to pay for salt to resell.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en: Firas has applied for another loan to add more goods and hookah flavors to his store and start selling different types of tobacco, so he can expand the store in the future, as the first loan was not enough to do it all.

loans.use: to add more hookah flavors to his store.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo está casado con Ofelia y tienen 10 hijos y entre toda la familia se dedican a la producción de café, actividad que realizan desde hace más de 30 años. Su esposa se encarga principalmente de las labores del hogar y sus hijos mayores; algunos ya casados, trabajan con Adolfo en el campo. Adolfo aprendió todo lo relacionado con el café al lado de su padre y ahora él ha enseñado a sus hijos todo lo que sabe. Para la siguiente cosecha Adolfo necesita un crédito para poder pagar a los cortadores que contratará, pues aunque su familia es numerosa no se dan abasto ellos solos. Adolfo tiene un terreno que quiere resembrar con café pues las plantas que tiene allí ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida productiva. Además del café Adolfo y su familia también tienen sembrados 500 árboles de limón y 3 hectáreas de caña. Pasando la cosecha a Adolfo le gustaría hacer mejoras en su casa pues algunos de sus hijos aún viven allí y hace unos meses nació el más pequeño de todos.
texts.en:
Adolfo is married to Ofelia and they have 10 children. His entire family is involved in coffee production and he has been in this line of work for more than 30 years. Adolfo’s wife is in charge of the household duties. His children are grown and some of them are married. They work with Adolfo in the fields.

He learned everything about growing coffee by working alongside his father. Now he passes on his knowledge to his own children. For the next harvest, Adolfo is requesting a loan so that he can hire workers. Even though he has a large family, there is too much work for them to handle. Adolfo has a plot of land that needs to be replanted with coffee since the current crop has completed its productive life cycle. In addition, Adolfo and his family have planted 500 lemon trees and three hectares of sugar cane. When he is not working in the fields, Adolfo enjoys making improvements to his home since some of his children still live there. A few months ago his youngest grandchild was born.

loans.use: to hire workers for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos con su esposa y vive en el municipio de Potrerillos, Villanueva, Cortes.
Don Manuel trabajo por varios años en una empresa maquiladora y luego quedo sin empleo, pues hace cinco años que decidió establecer su propio negocio de pulpería que administra juntamente con su esposa, vende granos básicos, azúcar, harina, café, sal, manteca, pan, huevos, refrescos, jugos, trapeadores, plátanos y verduras. Manuel tiene también su taller de soldadura donde genera otros ingresos. El préstamo que solicita es su primer ciclo y lo va invertir en surtir más la pulpería para poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y que encuentren todo lo que necesitan en un solo lugar. Su meta es obtener más ingresos para darles una buena educación a sus hijos y mantener un buen record crediticio con la institución para continuar invirtiendo y creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 42, is married and has three children.  He lives in the Potrerillos municipality in Villanueva, Cortes.

Manuel worked for several years at a factory business.  He was later left without employment.  Five years ago he decided to establish his own business, a grocery store, which he runs together with his wife.  He sells basic grains, sugar, flour, coffee, salt, shortening, bread, eggs, soft drinks, juice, mops, bananas, and vegetables.

Manuel also has his soldering shop where he generates other income.

The loan he is requesting is his first cycle, and he will use it to better stock his grocery store.  He will do this in order to be able to offer his customers more variety and so that they find everything they need in one place.

His goal is to get more income in order to give his children a good education and to maintain a good credit history with the institution.  He wants to do this in order to continue investing and growing with his business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, flour, eggs, meat, dairy products, churros, soft drinks, bread, coffee, salt, and others to stock his business.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Ms Saira is an enthusiastic 22-year-old lady who plays a vital role in improving the lives of her family members. She works selling plastic products such as baskets, buckets, boxes, bowls etc. in her community and in the local market. Her father is not well enough to be employed, so she is striving hard to meet the needs of her family.

Saira has applied for her first loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase more merchandise such as baskets, buckets and bowls in various sizes to stock in her enterprise so as to increase her sales. Saira encounters challenges in her business as she tries to rise from poverty, and she will use her profits to continue purchasing merchandise and increasing her income in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise such as baskets, buckets and bowls in various sizes to stock in her business.

loans.name: Victor Omar

texts.es: Víctor tiene 25 años de edad  vive en la ciudad de Quevedo,  está casado. Hace 5 años atras  su padre le regalo una  moto, el  no desaprovecho esa oportunidad y tomo la decisión de vender agua en galones  a todos los barrios de su ciudad. El  trabajada todos los días desde la 8 de la mañana hasta las  4 de la tarde . Con el préstamo quiere comprar una moto mas para su trabajo. Su meta es ser un distribuidor de agua
texts.en:
Víctor is 25 years old, married, and lives in the city of Quevedo. Five years ago, his father gave him a motorcycle but he did not take advantage of that opportunity. He later decided to sell water by the gallon in all of the neighborhoods in his city. Víctor works every day from 8 A.M. to 4 P.M.

With this loan, he will buy another motorcycle for his business. His goal is to become a water distributor.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his water distribution business.

loans.name: Roger Alexi

texts.es: Roger tiene 23 años de edad, está casado tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. El tiene 10 años de realizar actividades agrícolas, produce maíz, frijoles y café. La producción la vende en el mercado local. El está solicitando 20,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pago de limpieza para la finca de café y sus cultivos de maíz y frijoles, con esta asistencia el espera lograr buenas cosechas e incrementar sus ingresos. Su meta es sembrar café a tres manzanas de terreno.
texts.en:
Roger, age 23, is married and has two children.  He lives in a village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  

He has been working in agriculture for ten years.  He produces corn, beans, and coffee.  He sells the production at the local market.

He is requesting 20,000 lempiras to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and to pay to clear the coffee farm and his corn and bean crops.  With this help he hopes to get good harvests and increase his income.  His goal is to plant three ‘manzanas’ [Central American unit of land measurement] of coffee.

loans.use: to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and to pay to clear the coffee farm and his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is married to a business-oriented woman, and the couple is blessed with six children, all of whom to to school. A hardworking man who wants to succeed in life, Ruben has been engaged in the livestock business for four years. He has thus far raised two sows and eight pigs to be fattened. One of his sows will give birth in December, while the other is due in January. He also grows corn on his ten hectares of land.

Ruben is seeking a loan of PHP15,000 to buy stocks of livestock feed and repair the roof of his pig pen. He believes that his hog-raising business will help him to improve his family's standard of living and educate all of his children.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and roofing for his pig pen.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: This is Sharifa, a mother of four kids. She opened a mini-market in front of her house, instead of the one inside the home, to work in while her husband is on duty serving with the military. Now Sharifa has applied for this loan, to add more goods to the store that the customers have requested.

loans.use: to buy more food and other products to resell in her store.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a 32-year-old, single mother of one child, who lives in Kasese,Uganda. She has been selling baby clothes for nine years, and the business has been very lucrative. Her major challenges are limited capital to meet the demand, and high rent for her sales space. Her dream is to set up a baby center that has a larger variety of baby items. Rehema is requesting a loan to buy baby clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes to resell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica es una señora de 38 años de edad, ella esta casada y vive en Suchitepéquez.  Tiene  tres hijos de ellos 1 varón y 2 mujeres y solo 2 estudian en una escuela de la comunidad.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora queriendo lo mejor para su familia. Se dedica a la venta de ropa casual para damas, caballeros y niños la cual  esta ubicado en el centro de la comunidad.
Esta actividad lo inicio hace un año ya que anteriormente vendía zapatos pero la demanda es muy baja, de esta manera decidió invertir su capital en ropa casual ya que tienen precios económicos y es lo que prefieren los clientes teniendo mejor demanda.
Por la temporada del año ha visto que la demanda de la ropa aumenta. Ahora ella solicita un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para comprar más ropa y tener en existencia  variedad satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes. 
Entres sus mas grandes sueños es emprender otro negocio así mismo ampliando la venta de ropa, generando buenas ganancias y mejorar la economía de su familia.
texts.en: Veronica, 38, is married and lives in Suchitepéquez. She has three children: one son and two daughters. Only two of them study at the local school. She is a hard-working woman who wants the best for her family. She works selling casual clothing for women, men, and children. She sells in the center of the city. She started doing this about a year ago. Previously, she sold shoes, but the demand is very low. This is way she decided to invest her money in casual clothing, which is low-cost. It is what her customers prefer and the demand is higher. She has noticed that the demand for clothing has increased this season. She is applying for a loan of Q 8,000 to buy more clothing and have a variety of clothing on hand to meet the needs of her customers. Among her greatest dreams are to start another business and grow her clothing business, generating a good income and improving her family's economic state.

loans.use: to buy casual clothing to increase her sales.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es: El grupo “Artesanas del Fresno” esta conformado por solo mujeres que son muy trabajadoras y responsables, el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque casi todas se dedican a las artesanía que son los bordados y tejidos, por eso son artesanas y lo de fresno por su comunidad. Doña María Juana es una persona mayor de edad conoce muy bien de donde nació el bordado y el tejido de la comunidad, ella tiene 69 años de edad ya es viuda ahora vive sola pero muy cercas de sus hijos y casi pasa todo el día con sus nietos. Doña María Juana comenta que antes la lana era natural por lo que ahora ya no solo es sintética, antes ellos mismos elaboraban esta producto, primero lavaban la lana del borrego que salía cuando les cortaban la lana, se hacia lino con la lana ya bien lavada y lo obtenían con ayuda de un instrumento de madera, después tejían todos estos hilos de lana hasta obtener una tela y finalmente pintaban la tela los colores mas comunes eran el negro, café y gris. Las cosas han cambiado ahora ya nada de esto se hace porque las telas ya son de muy mala calidad. Ella bordando lleva ya 30 años desde que sus hijos eran pequeños comenta que esto le ayudo de mucho para darles estudios a sus hijos también ayudaba con los gastos del hogar cuando su esposo se quedaba sin empleo, vendía todos los días lunes en Ixtlahuaca sus bordados, Ahora ya solo ofrece con sus conocidos de la comunidad esta sola y muchas veces pues no tiene para cubrir sus necesidades básicas como alimentación, calzado y vestimenta por eso se dedica a esto, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar estambres de colores, tela y aujas. Su desafío es que muchas veces sus trabajo ya no lo valoran como antes y no le quieren pagar lo que realmente es el precio, comenta que es muy pasado ya que se tardan varios días elaborando este trabajo porque todo es echo a mano, ella hace chalecos, morrales, colchas, suéteres con figuras representativas de la comunidad, como pájaros, gretas, estrellas, flores, etc. Una de las metas de doña Juana es llegar a vender muchos bordados para poder compra maíz, porque si no comprar no tendrá para hacer sus tortillas durante todo el año ya que es uno de sus alimentos primordiales de todos los días. Todas las integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas por el préstamo ya que podrá compra todo el material que les hace falta y podrán cumplir con sus pedidos ya atrasados. Angelina, Leonila, Lucia, Gregoria, Maria, Gregoria, y María Lucina invertirán en los bordados, mientras que María de los Ángeles y Juana Iríais invertirán en cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Artesanas del Fresno group is made up of only women who are very hardworking and responsible.  They chose the name because almost all of them make a living in handicrafts (embroidery and textiles), so they're artisans, and "Fresno" is because of their community.

María Juana is an older person.  She's very familiar with the origins of embroidery and weaving in the community.  She's 69 years old and a widow.  She lives alone now, but very close to her children, and she spends almost all day with her grandchildren.

María Juana says that in the past yarn was natural, but that now it's only synthetic.  They used to make it themselves.  First they washed the wool that came from the sheep when they sheared it.  They made linen with the well-cleaned wool, with the help of a wooden implement.  Then they wove all this wool thread until they had fabric.  Finally they dyed the fabric; the most common colors were black, brown, and grey.

Things have changed, and now none of this is done because the fabrics are of very poor quality.  She has been embroidering for 30 years, since her children were little.  She says this helped a lot, so she could give her children an education.  It also helped with the household expenses when her husband didn't have a job.  She sold her embroidery in Ixtlahuaca every Monday.  Now she only sells to acquaintances in the community.  She's alone and often doesn't have enough money to cover her basic necessities like food, shoes, and clothing.  This is why she does this.

She has requested this loan to buy colored yarn, fabric, and needles.

Her challenge is that often her work isn't valued as it was before, and people don't want to pay the true price.  She says it's very old-fashioned; it takes several days to do this kind of work because everything is handmade.  She makes jackets, backpacks, bedspreads, and sweaters with figures that represent the community such as birds, stars, flowers, etc.

One of Juana's goals is to sell a lot of embroidery to be able to buy corn.  It's an essential everyday ingredient, and if she doesn't buy it, she won't be able to make her tortillas throughout the year.

All the members of the group are very grateful for the loan because they'll be able to buy all the materials they need and finish the work they're behind on.  Angelina, Leonila, Lucia, Gregoria, María, and María Lucina will invest in embroidery, while María de los Ángeles and Juana Iris will invest in cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy fabric for embroidery.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Lucia es una mujer de 60 años de edad ella esta casada y vive en Suchitepéquez. Ella tiene tres hijos 1 varón y 2 mujeres las cuales ya están casados.
A pesar de su edad ella  quiere seguir trabajando junto a su esposo mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica femenina de las que usan en su región esto lo realiza desde su casa ya que los clientes ya la conocen y la buscas hasta donde vive.
 Empezó esta actividad  hace 10 años iniciando con una venta de alimentos preparados esto la ayudo a reunir mas capital y luego inicio con la venta de ropa ya que mantienen los precios dejando una ganancia buena. 
Por la temporada del año ha visto que la demanda de la ropa típica aumenta  de esta manera ella solicita un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para comprar mas ropa típica femenina  teniendo variedad, estilos y tamaños para que sus clientes estén satisfechos con lo que compran.
Ella sueña que en un futuro pueda  seguir ampliando su negocio o a lo mejor emprender otro tipo de negocio mejorando sus ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 60 year-old woman who is married and lives in Suchitepéquez.  She has 3 children: 1 man and 2 women who are all married.

In spite of her age, she wants to keep working with her husband so that they can improve the living conditions of their family.  Lucia has a business selling traditional women's clothing of the type that is worn in her region.  She carries out this business from her house, because her customers know her and they come to her house to buy.

She started in business 10 years ago, initially selling prepared food.  This helped her to accumulate some capital.  Later she got into the clothing business, because these products keep their value and leave her with good earnings.

During the current season she has seen the demand for traditional clothing increase, and so she is seeking a loan of 7,000 Guatemalan quetzales to buy more women's clothing so that she will have the variety, styles and sizes to satisfy her customers.

Lucia dreams in the future of continuing to expand her business, or perhaps of starting up another type of business to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to increase her sales

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en: Wisam, a 31-year-old conservative woman, refused to appear in the photo for religious reasons, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Wisam is a housewife who takes care of her two sons (4 and 2 years old) and a 6-year-old daughter. Her husband works in a hotel and owns a store where he sells frozen food: meat, fish, and chicken. He is now adding shelves to stock other types of food products in order to increase revenue. Wisam has applied for this loan to help her husband expand the store and offer a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of food products to stock shelves

loans.name: St Veronica Group

texts.en:
Mary, a 33-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda, has been operating a retail shop for four years and also earns a salary as a civil servant. Realizing that her meager government salary could not help her meet the needs of her family, she began the business. Like most retail shop owners she faces the challenges of price fluctuations and license fees, while her dream is to own a wholesale shop.

Mary intends to use her portion of the loan to buy soda, salt, cooking oil, paraffin and soap to sell. She is a member of St. Veronica's Group, whose members guarantee each other's loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy soda, salt, cooking oil, paraffin and soap to sell.

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en: Sabha is a 38-year-old married woman; she is a mother of four. Sabha is trying to help her husband in supporting the family and improving their living conditions, so she started selling blankets at home. Now she wants to get more blankets and add selling bed sheets, too. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to get more blankets and add selling bed sheets.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis is a 47-year-old married woman and is in the business of selling bed sheets in her community. She always has a great collection of beautiful embroidered bed sheets to offer. She is well appreciated in her community and counts a good list of customers. Two years ago, she decided to initiate her business when her husband lost his job due to recession in the economy. Determined to earn money on her own in order to get ahead and to help her husband with expenses at home, she started working, selling different designs of bed sheets. She makes sales going door to door, and she also makes sales from her own home, where customers come when they need a new one or when she has new merchandise. Nargis is a mother of four daughters; she is always worried about their future and dreams to provide them with a better education to improve their standard of living. To make more variety of bed sheets available for sale, she is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000. This will enable her to purchase more designs of bed sheets to offer to her customers. She desires to spend the part of income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more designs of bed sheets to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Nicoline

texts.en:
She is a widow with two children.  They live in Bamenda, Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon.

This widow has faced many challenges.  She has fought over her husband's properties with her in-laws who want to take everything away from her.  Her husband, who was so supportive of her at an early age, died, leaving her to raise her children alone and educate and feed them.  Her father died at a very tender age, and she did not have a good foundation In school.

She joined GHAPE in 2007, and has taken and successfully repaid three loans.  She says if given the new loan she has requested, she will buy salon items like a hair drier, hair mesh, hair oil, and men's caps, and buy cups, flour and other items which will facilitate the smooth functioning of her restaurant.
