Jenith has earned a living for the last 11 years from buying and selling fruits. She earns PHP 4,000 a month. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional fruits to sell such as mangoes and bananas. 

Jenith joined GDMPC in 2011 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell such as mangoes and bananas.

loans.name: Delcina

texts.en: Delcina is a 52-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is 31, while the youngest is 26. She raises hogs. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional piglets, feeds, like hog booster and hog finisher mash, and pig supplements, like anti-diarrhea medicines that help the pigs to grow healthy. In the future, Delcina would like to invest in other business ventures in order to have a sustainable livelihood for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a widow. He is 55 years old and lives in Poblacion, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Rodrigo is operating a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years and every month he earns 15,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. 

In 2010, Rodrigo joined GDMPC. Rodrigo hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Amormia

texts.en: Amormia, 36, is a married entrepreneur from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She has 4 children and makes a living from her transport service business. She started this business almost 11 years ago and she earns 10,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing 50,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which Amormia joined in 2011, to obtain accessories and tires. She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a 35000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks of soap, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, and other items to sell in her general store. 

Lorna has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Lorna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soap, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tuvshin

texts.en: Mr. Tuvshin is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in small house in Sukhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His wife Myagmarsuren, aged 26, gave birth to a daughter 8 months ago and is staying with their daughter at home. His son Osohbayar, aged 17, has just enrolled in university this year. He has been operating a public transportation service business since 2007. He is a hardworking, honest and responsible man who says that his goal is to educate his children and let them live a better life in future. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to cover his son's university tuition and other school-related expenses to get his son highly educated.

loans.use: To cover his son's university tuition and other school-related expenses to get his son highly educated

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and reselling charcoal. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, shampoo, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny's main source of income comes from his corn-raising business. He is 22 years old, single. He is from Tugas, Tangub City and been 6 years in farming, earning an amount of 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Manny joined GDMPC. Manny is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 46 years old, married and has six children. To make a living, she buys rice and re-sells it for a profit. She usually earns about P500 for each sack of rice sold. She has been able to give daily allowances to her children out of her income. Her spouse is a farmer. Giving a good education to all their children is their main goal. 

Now, Marissa would to borrow a loan of P10,000 to buy three sacks of rice to sell. It will help her continuously offer rice to her customers. Someday, she hopes to expand her business and keep earning a profit from it.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a retail store owner who has extended good services to his customers for over 10 years now. He is married to his partner in managing the store. Aside from the retail store, the couple also raises hogs for additional income. They usually gain 8,000 PHP each month from their businesses. 

He is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to invest in expanding his sales. He will buy to buy coffee, bread, eggs, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

Someday, he hopes to achieve a stable income from their businesses so he can pay his four children's school expenses. He had 10 children, but the rest have settled into marriage and live apart from him. His photo was taken when he was arranging his merchandise at the store.

loans.use: to buy coffee, bread, eggs, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 47 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She is married to a farmer. She sells rice to earn an income. She gains about PHP 500 for each sack of rice she sells. Marilyn would like to increase her sales as well as her income, but she has insufficient funds to do this. She is now asking for PHP 10,000 to buy rice to sell. She hopes to keep acquiring good income from her small business and pay for the school expenses of her children. She will be happy and proud to see them as professionals in their chosen careers someday.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Isabel es una mujer de 54 años de edad esta en unión simple con su esposo y vive en Sololá. Tiene 6 hijos de ellos 2 varones de los cuales ellos están casados,  también  4 mujeres de ellas 1 esta casada 2 están estudiando y 1 que trabaja independientemente.
Es una persona amable y sobre todo trabajadora, ella se dedica a fabricar prendas de vestir típicos que se utilizan la mujer indígenas de su región. Esto  los vende en el mercado local y a personas que le hacen algunos pedidos personales.
Ella  inicio este trabajo hace 25 años atrás, aprendiéndolo de su madre cuando aun viva con ella.  Decide realizar este trabajo después de casada ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en alguna escuela por la baja economía de su familia. Junto a su esposo aportan ahora los ingresos y mejorando las condiciones de vida de la familia.
Por la temporada del año ha visto que esta prenda tiene mejor demanda, de esta manera desea invertir más capital en su materia prima. Solicita un préstamo de  Q 3,000.00 para comprar hilo de varios colores y jaspeado (hilo teñido con figuras)  para fabricar mayor cantidad de prendas y tener mejores ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es ver a sus últimas 2 hijas teniendo una carrera profesional académica, con el apoyo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel is a woman of 54. She and her husband live in Sololá. They have six children, two sons who are married, and also four daughters, of whom one is married, two are in school, and one works independently.

She is a friendly person and, above all, hard-working. Her work is making traditional clothing that the indigenous women in her region use. She sells these items in the local market and to people who give her special orders.

She began this work 25 years ago, having learned it from her mother when she was still living with her. She decided to do this work after she married, since she hadn't had the opportunity for any education because of the low economic level of her family. Along with her husband, she now contributes to the family income and they are improving the living conditions of the family.

She has seen that this clothing has greater demand at this time of the year, so she wants to invest more capital in her basic supplies. She is applying for a loan of 3,000 Guatemalan quetzales to buy thread of various colors and "jaspeado" (thread woven with figures) to make a greater quantity of clothing and have better earnings.

Her greatest dream is to see her two youngest daughters complete their secondary school training, with the help of her husband.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Alberto Alejandro

texts.es: Alberto vive en  la ciudad de Quevedo provincia de Los Ríos tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijo. Su padre le enseño el trabajo familiar que es la fundición de acero. En la actualidad trabaja junto a su padre de lunes a sábado desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 6 de la tarde. Con el crédito comprara un horno para fundir el acero de bronce. Sus  aspiraciones son  tener varios hornos para fundir metales y poder enseñar este trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Alberto lives in the city of Quevedo in the Los Ríos province. He is 24 years old, single, with no children. His father taught him the family business, which is steel smelting. He now works with his father from Monday through Saturday, from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening.

With the loan, he will purchase a furnace to smelt bronze steel. His aspirations are to have various furnaces to smelt metals and to be able to teach this work to other people.

loans.use: to buy a furnace to smelt metals.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store like bread, canned goods, soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc.

Mercedita has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Mercedita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store like bread, canned goods, soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 47 years old, married with 2 adults and 1 school-age child in her family.  She lived in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  The major source of income of the family is fishing, primarily operated by her husband, operated for 3 years having an average monthly income of Php 2,800.  

Nimfa took another loan from PMPC to purchase fishing net.  She hopes to catch more fish using her new fishing net to provide the daily needs of the family and put aside savings for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is married and has 1 child. She is 32 years old, and she lives in Polacion, Bonifacio. Faith owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. In 2011, Faith joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and better her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Don Jorge es un hombre de agricultor de 46 años de edad, el esta casado y vive en Suchitepéquez. Junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos la cual el mayor estudia una carrera académica y los otros dos estudian educación básica.
El es un hombre trabajador siendo así su actividad principal el  cultivo de café al igual que su esposa trabaja como ama de casa juntos aportando a la economía de la familia.
El quiere emprender un nuevo negocio ya que el obtuvo un kiosco de una empresa de bebidas gaseosas donde el  quiere poner una tienda de abarrotes.
De esta manera el solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la comprar mercadería para luego poder hacer la apertura de su tienda de abarrotes.
Esto es con el fin de poder  mejorar sus condiciones económicas de la familia teniendo como una meta y un sueño de poder terminar de darles los estudios académicos a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Jorge is farmer who is 46 years old. He is married and lives in Suchitepéquez with his wife and their three children. The oldest child is high school, and the other two are in the first years of secondary school.

He is a hard-working man, since his main activity is growing coffee, while his wife works as a homemaker, together supporting the family economy.

He wants to begin a new business, since he obtained a kiosk from a soft drink business,  and there he wants to set up a grocery store. To do this, he is applying for a loan of 5,000 Guatemalan quetzales to buy merchandise so that he will then be able to open his grocery store. He is doing this with the goal of being able to improve the economic conditions of his family. His goal and dream is to be able to give a high school education to his children.

loans.use: to buy groceries to begin his buisness.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Don Natividad es un hombre agricultor de 36 años de edad esta en unión simple con su esposa y vive en Sololá.
El se dedica al cultivo de verduras tales como cebolla, papa, zanahoria, ejote y repollo, esto lo cultiva en parcelas que alquila a pocos metros de su residencia, siendo así su principal fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia. 
Tiene 18 años de realizar esta actividad, ya que es el primer trabajo que le enseño su padre desde que el estudiaba la mitad de la jornada del día y trabajaba la otra mitad. 
Desde que el termino sus estudios de una carrera académicas quiso seguir trabajando en la agricultura ya que estas verduras han mantenido el precio en el mercado local generando ganancias buenas para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Por  la temporada del año   las cosechas son mejores así que el decide solicitar un préstamo de Q3,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y fertilizante que utilizara para cultivar esta verdura expandiendo mas su cultivo.
Tener una parcela propia es su mayor sueño, ya que ahora tiene que pagar para poder cultivar estas  verduras en parcelas que alquilando.
texts.en:
Don Natividad is a farmer of 36. He and his wife live in Sololá. He grows vegetables such as onions, potatoes, carrots, green beans, and cabbage. He grows these on parcels of land that he rents a few meters from his home. This is his principal source of income for his family.

He has been doing this work for 18 years, since it is the first work that his father taught him, since he went to school for half a day and worked for the other half.

After he finished his high school studies, he wanted to continue working in agriculture, since these vegetables have maintained their price in the local market, generating good earnings to improve the living conditions of his family.

At this season of the year, the harvests are better, and so he decided to apply for a loan of 3000 Guatemalan quetzales to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer that he will use to grow these vegetables, expanding his crops more.

To have his own parcel of land is his greatest dream, since now he has to pay to be able to grow these vegetables on parcels that he rents.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Isrrael Rufino

texts.es: Isrrael  vive en el sector norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil  llamado Las Orquídeas. Está casado tiene 2 hijos. El comenzó su negocio que es la  venta  de  comida, se inicio con este negocio  ya hace 12 años atrás a causa de la falta de empleo que tiene el país, el  no conseguía trabajo por eso tomo la decisión de dar la apertura al negocio de venta de comida en su casa. El trabaja junto a su esposa de lunes a viernes desde las  10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Con el crédito comprara una cocina industrial y víveres en general. Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante reconocido en el país por sus comidas típicas ecuatorianas.
texts.en:
Isrrael lives in the northern sector of the city of Guayaquil named Las Orquídeas. He is married and has two children. He began his business, which is food sales, 12 years ago. Because of the lack of employment in his country, he could not find work, and so he decided to open the business of food sales in his home. He works with his wife from Monday through Friday from 10 in the morning until 10 at night. 

With the loan, he will buy a new industrial stove and general supplies. His dream is to have a great restaurant well-known in the country for its typical Ecuadorian food.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and general supplies.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 41 years old, and his wife, Chrep, is 39. They have been married since 2012 and have four daughters. Two are garment workers and other two are in school. The family lives in a village about 28 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Touch fishes and builds houses for a living, while his wife is a garment worker. In addition, they grow rice when rice farming season comes.  

Touch is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,300 to improve his rice farm. He will use it to buy fertilizer and purchase a cow to raise.

He hopes he will be able to earn extra income from selling calves when the cow delivers a baby.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice farm and purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a new recognized member of PMPC under the individual program. She is 44 years of age and married with two adult-age children. Her major business is a sari-sari (variety) store for selling a variety of basic commodities. She has operated the business for two years, having a monthly income of 4,000 Php (Philippines pesos).  

She decided to join PMPC to have financial access to support her business. She took her first loan from PMPC in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase additional grocery stock for sale, hoping to generate more sales to increase the income to invest more capital in the business and to save for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock for sale.

loans.name: Mokote

texts.fr: Mokote est un homme de 27 ans, célibataire, père d'un enfant âgés de  02 ans.Il est commerçant dans un quartier de la capitale où il gère une mini quincaillerie depuis 1 ans.Son activité étant certe jeune, mais  grâce à sa qualité de bon commerçant a pu en si peu de temps fidéliser une clientèle considérable, mais qu'il n'arrive cependant plus à satisfaire car son capital ne lui permet guère de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante susceptible de satisfaire la demande croissante.Afin de palier à ce problème, il voudrait ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante en diluants,seaux de peintures, tôles et biens d'autres produits de quincaillerie, ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande, mais surtout d'augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses bénéfices. Ces bénéfices lui permettront d'agrandir son activité en vue d'en faire une grande quincaillerie, mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mokote, age 27, is a single father of a 2-year-old child. Over the past year, he has been running a small hardware store in a district of the capital. While this is a rather new activity, his strengths as a businessman have helped him to quickly build a substantial and loyal customer base, which he can no longer satisfy due to a lack of funds needed to maintain his stock of merchandise. 

To overcome this hurdle, he is seeking a loan to stock up on merchandise such as thinners, buckets, paint, sheet metal, and many other hardware products. This will help him to meet customer demand and to bolster his sales and his profits. 

He plans to use these profits to expand his activity and turn it into a large hardware store, and to provide for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to stock up on hardware items such as light bulbs, paint, sheet metal, thinners, buckets, etc. for his store.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 55 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 6 hijos. Reside en compañía de su suegra, esposo, he hijos en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Doña María siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde hace 15 años que se dedica a la  producción de café, maíz y frijoles para la venta.
Actualmente ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  25,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y pago de jornaleros para la limpieza de la finca y los cultivos.
Considera que el préstamo le ayudara a proporcionar el manejo adecuado para obtener mayor rendimiento de sus cultivos, su meta es lograr hacer producir 11 manzanas de tierra con el cultivo de café.
texts.en:
María, age 55, is in a common-law marriage, and she has six children.  She lives with her mother-in-law, her husband, and her children in a rural community in the Nueva Frontera municipality in the Santa Barbara department.

María has always worked in agriculture.  For 15 years she has been producing coffee, corn, and beans that she sells. 

She has currently requesting a loan for 25,000 lempiras to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and to pay day workers to clear the farm and the crops.  She feels that the loan will help her provide adequate management in order to get greater yield from her crops.  Her goal is to manage to produce 11 ‘manzanas’ [a land measurement] of coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and to pay day workers to clear the farm and the crops.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: Víctor  vive en la ciudad de Quevedo tiene 25 años de edad. Es  divorciado tiene 3 hijos que estudian en una escuela pública del sector. El  se había quedado sin trabajo  hace 6 años atrás y fue ahí  cuando un amigo lo llevo a trabajar vendiendo frutas y legumbres. En  la actualidad el se ha independizado y dio la apertura  en los exteriores de su casa un puesto de venta de frutas y legumbres. Con el préstamo quiere comprar legumbres, hortalizas, frutas. Su sueño es tener un local propio y llegar a ser un distribuidor mayorista de frutas y legumbres para así poderle dar a sus hijos una excelente vida
texts.en:
Víctor lives in the city of Quevedo.  He is 25 years old.  He is divorced with three children that attend a public school in the area.  He had been without work six years ago and it was then that a friend took him to work selling fruits and vegetables.  At present he has become independent and gave the opening of the exterior of his house over to a place from which to sell fruits and vegetables. 
 
He wants to buy legumes, vegetables and fruits with the loan.  His dream is to have his own business location and to become a wholesale distributor of fruits and vegetables to thus be able to give his children an excellent life.

loans.use: to buy legumes, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva of Poblacion, Bonifacio, helps her family through running a barber shop business. She’s a 49-year-old married mom of three kids who tries her best to earn on her own. For 16 years, she has managed this business and earns about 4,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. 

For the time being, she’s in need of buying scissors, combs and items to use in her business. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and thanks GDMPC microfinance for the loan of 5,000 PHP they provided to her. Eva desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy scissors, combs and items to use in her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Violeta has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha and her husband are farmers. They grow sesame and beans on their farmland in the village where they live. In addition to caring for their crops, Sokha is a weaver and her husband raises cows at home. The couple has been married since 2005, and they have two children, one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other is too young for school. The family is living in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Sokha requests a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorized hand tiller. Because she does not have her own motorized hand tiller, she has to spend lots of money for renting one. With the motorized hand tiller that she will buy with money from the loan, Sokha will not have to spend lots of money to rent the equipment she needs any more.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es: Freddy vive en el  cantón La Libertad, de la provincia de Santa Elena, tiene 21 años de edad es soltero, Actualmente estudia en la universidad la carrera de  ensamblaje de computadoras. El trabaja en lo que le gusta que es la reparaciones de computadoras. Actualmente en su casa dio la apertura de un taller de reparaciones de computadoras. Con el préstamo comprara herramientas, piezas de computadoras. Su meta es abrir un cyber.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in La Libertad canton, Santa Elena province. He is 21, single and he studies computer assembly at the university.

He enjoys repairing computers, and that is why he has this line of work. He recently opened a computer repair workshop in his house.

With the loan, he will buy tools and spare parts. His goal is to open a cybercafé.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for computers.

loans.name: Ricardina Marleny

texts.es: Ricardina vive en el sur de Guayaquil en  un barrio llamado  El Guasmo. Es casada tiene 2 hijos que son mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Ricardina  comenzó de casualidad ya que ella iba a dejar a un nieto a la escuela en su carro y las madres de los alumnos le pidieron  que les haga expreso a sus hijos también. En la actualidad ella ofrece transporte de servicio escolar. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar llantas, pintar el carro etc. Su meta es comprarse otro carro mas para alquilarlo y que le genere más  ingreso a su casa
texts.en: Ricardina lives in the south of Guayaquil in a neighborhood called “El Guasmo”. She’s married with 2 children who are both independent adults. Ricardina started her business by chance when she was dropping off her grandson to school in her vehicle and the mothers of the other students asked her to drop off their children too. Currently, she offers transportation with school service. With the loan, she wants to buy tires and paint for her vehicle. Her goal is to buy an extra vehicle to lease it and earn additional household income.

loans.use: to buy tires and paint for her vehicle.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer lives in Mitan-ag, Bonifacio. He earns a living by cultivating bananas and engaging in a gardening business. He has been working as a farmer for 14 years, to support the needs of his two children. He gets an income of 5,000 a month for this business. For a 35-year-old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Elmer is borrowing the amount of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, to buy farm fertilizers. He joined GDMPC in 2009. His plan for the future is, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia, She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in the family's household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new, 25,000 PHP loan, for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to satisfy her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Celia hopes to grow her business in the coming years, and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to add to her store's inventory.

loans.name: Jacqueline Elizabeth

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 26 años de edad es soltera, no tiene hijos. Se dedica a la confeccion  de prendas de vestir de todo tipo, el tiempo que lleva en la actividad es de 8 años aproximadamente, realiza sus costuras de propia producción y también servicios de costura para empresas privadas que le provee de todos los insumos para la confección de las prendas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de tela y tambien para otra maquina de coser, para que pueda seguir con lo que hace. Esta muy contenta por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 26 years old, single, and has no children.  She works making all types of clothing.  She has been doing this work for about eight years.  She sews her own garments and also offers services to private businesses that provide her with all of the supplies to make their clothing items.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase fabric and another sewing machine so that she can continue with her work.  She is very happy with the support she is receiving because it will help her very much.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 36 years old, married to Marcelo and has two children. 

She sells fruits and vegetables while her spouse is in a blacksmith business, making knives of different sizes to sell. They both generate income and gain about PHP 10,000 each month. It goes for their meals and school expenses. 

Now, Virginia is borrowing additional capital to invest in developing her spouse's business. She is asking for PHP 19,000 to to buy more metals used in making knives for the blacksmith business. It will help increase their income necessary to pay matriculation fees on time. She will also keep diversifying her vegetable vending business.

With hard work and patience in the businesses, Virginia will achieve a prosperous life for her family someday.

loans.use: to buy more metals used in making knives for the blacksmith business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 34-year-old resident of Poblacion, Bonifacio. She provides her three children's needs from the little amount of 4,000 PHP she gains monthly from her corn-farming business. She has raised corn for six years as an aid to the income gained by her husband. 

However, in this year she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP at GDMPC microfinance to buy farm chemical supplies. Wilma wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy farm chemical supplies.

loans.name: Urjinsuren

texts.en:
Urjinsuren is 49 years old and lives with her husband in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband, Dambiinyam, is retired and also helps her business. 

She has been operating a grocery store since 2003, starting with a rental counter at the local market, and she expanded her business by building her own workplace for the grocery store. 

She is planning to open a billiard playing place for local customers. She needs to purchase construction materials to decorate the billiard room and also billiard tables. 

Urjinsuren is a hardworking, responsible and honest woman who needs 3,000,000,MNT to purchase billiard tables and construction materials for her newly starting billiard-playing place.

loans.use: To purchase billiard tables and construction materials for her newly starting billiard-playing place.

loans.name: Edylengris

texts.fr: Eddy est un homme de 33 ans, commerçant dans un quartier de la capitale où il gère une mini quincaillerie depuis 3 ans. Sa qualité de bon commerçant a pu en si peu de temps fidéliser une clientèle considérable, mais qu'il n'arrive cependant plus à satisfaire car son capital ne lui permet guère de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante susceptible de satisfaire la demande croissante.Afin de palier à ce problème, il voudrait ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante Augmenter le stock de ses marchandises (5 paquet de bougies, cables, 10 paires de capo, 20 retroviseurs machettes, peintures, tôles, seaux, diluants...) et biens d'autres produits de quincaillerie, ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande, mais surtout d'augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses bénéfices. Ces bénéfices lui permettront d'agrandir son activité en vue d'en faire une grande quincaillerie, mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Edy, age 33, has been running a small hardware store in a district of the capital for the past three years. His strengths as a businessman have helped him to quickly build a substantial and loyal customer base, which he can no longer satisfy due to a lack of funds needed to maintain his stock of merchandise. 

To overcome this hurdle, he is seeking a loan to stock up on merchandise. He plans to buy 5 packs of candles, cables, 10 sets of hoods, 20 rear view mirrors, machetes, paint, sheet metal, buckets, thinners, etc. and many other hardware products. This will help him to meet customer demand and to bolster his sales and his profits. 

He plans to use these profits to expand his activity and turn it into a large hardware store, and to provide for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy 5 packs of candles, cables, 10 sets of hoods, 20 rear view mirrors, machetes, paint, sheet metal, buckets, thinners, etc. and many other hardware products for his store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Auria

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años de edad ha trabajado en su propia tienda general durante muchos años, y con esto siempre ha generado los ingresos para su hogar. Pero debido a problemas de violencia en la zona, tuvo que cerrar el negocio durante 5 años y comenzó a trabajar en otras actividades. Actualmente está volviendo a sacar la tienda adelante. Gracias a que ha podido ir teniendo buenas ventas, y buscando superar la dificultad de dinero, María con el préstamo espera comprar una vitrina y surtir los productos de la canasta familiar y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

Su sueño es tener una tienda cada vez más grande e incluirle cada vez más productos para aumentar la variedad de que ofrece. Además, aspira a poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María, 49, has worked in her own general store for many years earning an income for her home.  However, due to the problems with violence in the area, she had to close down her business for 5 years and start working in other activities. Currently, she’s trying to open up her store again. Given that her business has been doing well and looking to overcome financial difficulties, María hopes to buy a glass cabinet and stock her store with basic goods meeting customer demand.

loans.use: to buy a glass cabinet and basic goods.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza, 41, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cipriano, a watch technician and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Analiza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.She also has a buy and sell business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 60,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Analiza hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a married woman who has four children. She's 58 years old, and she lives in Poblacion, Bonifacio. Delia owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this kind of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Delia joined GDMPC in 2011. Delia wants to make improvements to her house, and to improve the general living conditions of her family, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Sugmed

texts.en:
Mrs.Sugmed is 24 years old and lives with her 5-year-old daughter and husband in a little house in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband works at a private mining company as an economist. She is planning to start her own clothing retail business at a rented counter at the local market. She has worked as a salesperson at that market for years and obtained business experience from that. 

She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I will run my business successfully and expand my business further." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import a variety of clothing from China and sell them at the local market as her newly starting business. She also mentioned that winter is coming and seasonal clothes sales increases during this time of the year.

loans.use: To import a variety of clothes from China and sell them at the local market as her newly starting business

loans.name: Mayra Pilar

texts.es: Mayra vive en la ciudad de Playas de la  provincia del Guayas. Tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos que estudian en una escuela privada cerca de su casa. Mayra tomo la decisión de buscar un empleo a raíz del abandono del padre de  sus hijos, pero por  la crisis económica que tiene el país no logro conseguir algun tipo de trabajo , fue entonces que decido tener un negocio propio, Mayra  compro reposteros, ollas de plásticos. en la actualidad ella vende todos estos productos. Ella trabaja en las calles ofertando sus productos a sus familiares  y vecinos. Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Con el préstamo comprar más utensilio de plásticos para la venta. Su seño es tener un local de venta de plásticos
texts.en: Mayra lives in the city of Playas in the province of Guayas.  She is 32 years old and a single mother to two children who study at a private school close to her house.  Mayra decided to look for work when the father of her children abandoned her.  Because of the economic crisis in her country, she was not able to find any kind of work, so she decided to start her own business.  She purchases plastic containers and plastic pots and sells them.  She works as a street vendor offering her products to her friends and neighbors.  She works from Monday to Friday from 8:00am until 4:00pm.  She will use this loan to purchase more plastic utensils to sell.  Her dream is to have a store to sell plastic items.

loans.use: to purchase plastic utensils and repair her house.

loans.name: Hilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hilda, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para mejorar la tienda en cuanto al inventario, además invertirá en el cultivo de maíz, Hilda comprara arroz, azúcar, aceite, y los materiales agrícolas.
Considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar la capacidad de las ventas en el negocio, manteniendo más productos variados para la satisfacción del cliente.
texts.en:
Hilda will use the new loan to improve her store in terms of inventory and as an investment towards farming corn. Hilda will buy rice, sugar, oil, and agricultural supplies.
Her previous loan helped her to improve the sales capacity of her business by providing a wide variety of products that keeps her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Estelita dreams to be able to provide her children with a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Columba

texts.en:
Columba, a widow, is 65 years old and lives in D-Fernan, Bonifacio. 

Columba buys and sells fruits like bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 13 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,300 to purchase more fruits to sell. Columba been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Columba's plan is to save her returns in order to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is peacefully living within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. He is 37 years of age, married and blessed with four children. All his four children are still studying. 

Edgar's wife owns a variety store while he is busy raising crops and pigs within his local community. Nowadays, he is fattening six and raising three sows and eight piglets.

He wants to sustain them with proper nutrition and ensure proper growth so that upon reaching their maturity period, he can dispose them at a higher price. But his capital intended for his livestock is no longer enough due to his expenses in preparing his corn field. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. He will use this loan to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines. He hopes that his hogs will gain weight so he can improve his financial status and support his children's education.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en:
Munkhzul, 27 years old, lives with her husband, who operates a taxi business, and son in their own apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2008 Munkhzul has worked in a beauty salon and has many clients, some of whom she meets in their homes.

Munkhzul is seeking a loan to improve her family's living conditions. Their apartment is small, having been built in the Soviet era, and requires some upgrades. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy a new radiator and double-glazed windows. She also wants to replace the old rusty water lines with new PVC and the electric lines with safer ones to prevent fires.

loans.use: to improve her family's living conditions through the purchase of a new radiator and double-glazed windows.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn, a 28-year-old married mother of two from Silanga, Tangub City, runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. In business for two years, she earns about 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined GDMPC and is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 39-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has three children, age 20, 18 and 5 years old. Her husband is a carpenter.

She is engaged in a basket-weaving business. She earns 4,000 PHP a month by doing the basket weaving. She works hard to support her family. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase nito or native palm for weaving. 

In the future, Adela would like to diversify into other ventures to support her family as well as finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy nito or native palm.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo's business is livestock and farming. He is 53 years of age, happily married and has been blessed with six children. Four children are married while one is under training for work and the youngest is still studying. Danilo and his wife work hard to earn for living to educate their youngest child and improve their living conditions.

His main goal is to increase the profit he generates from his livestock and farming business. Danilo started his livestock business in the year 1982. Aside from this livestock, he also grows corn and rice crops in his 1.5 hectare field. 

Now he would like to borrow additional working capital in the amount of PHP 40,000, allowing him to purchase hog feed and do maintenance of his corn-farming business. He is hoping for approval of his requested loan amount for him to improve his crop production and livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and maintain his corn-farming business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy additional stocks of rice for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in the family's household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, of 20,000 PHP, to buy additional stocks of rice for her business again. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and to pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Jane hopes to be able to acquire a commercial stall for her business and aspires to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of rice for her business

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is a widow with five children. He is 49 years old and resides in Buracan, Bonifacio. 

Melecio has a crop raising business, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. He has been doing this job for 13 years. 

Each month, he earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. In 2011, Melecio joined GDMPC. In the future, Melecio wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo has grown corn crops for 15 years and he has raised hogs for 30 years. Currently, he is raising one sow and plans to buy two piglets and hog feed. But his capital is not sufficient, so he would like to borrow a loan of PHP 30,000. 

He knows that through this loan amount requested, he could provide proper care to his crops and hogs, which will enable him to gain a better income that will serve his family's needs and provide a comfortable lifestyle. 

Alfredo still aims for continuous growth of his corn and hog-raising businesses. In addition, he hopes to have a continuous partnership with lenders so they will continue to support him financially.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and hog feed for the daily maintenance of his hogs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en:
For over five years in Migcanaway, Tangub City, Floramie, a 37-year-old married mother of 6 children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Recently, Floramie joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
This is Lanie, who previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Lanie is requesting a new loan for 20,000 PHP to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store, the better her profits which will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lanie hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos, 1 já frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É docente e do quadro do Ministério de Educação. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (aros, cimento, areia, barrotes, pedra, porta, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja terminar a sua obra e crescer profissionalmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais para garantir o pagamento do desembolso efectuado.
texts.en:
Amelia is married and the mother of 2 children, 1 of whom is already in School, lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She is a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education. With this loan she intends to purchase construction materials (hoops, cement, sand, beams, stone, doors and others) to continue building her house.

In future she hopes to complete her home and grow professionally. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work harder to guarantee payment of the loan.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (hoops, cement, sand, beams, stone, doors and others) to continue building her house.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
Ejemplo de mujer independiente y trabajadora es Marisabel de 35 años, madre de Sebastian de 4 años, quien ha sido su motor y motivo para desempeñarse en diversas zonas. Actualmente su condición de empleada le permite alquilar un cuarto independiente para ella y su pequeño. Desde hace 2 años viene realizando la labor de docente, no pudiendo desempeñarse como tal, pues no cuetna con titulo profesional debido a inconvenientes económicos.
 Gracias a la confianza de MFP y a través de un crédito accesible cumplió su comedido pudiendo así al fin dedicarse a lo que siempre fue su vocación de vida. Considera el trabajo de docente como uno de los mejores que haya podido escoger ya que el desempeñarse con los niños hace que se sienta muy útil en la sociedad.
No obstante dentro de los inconvenientes que le deja, es la falta de organización y solución en los problemas sindicales que presenta su magisterio , pero eso nunca fue motivo para desestimar sus deseos de ser participe de la educación de su país.
Dentro de sus necesidades como docente esta el adquirir una computadora ya que considera que es una herramienta muy necesaria que le permitirá ayudar a su labor como docente con el objetivo de hacer mas fluido su trabajo en beneficio de sus alumnos.
Este es su quinto crédito, como profesional considera que el buen ejemplo es la matriz del progreso, es por ello que siempre ha sido muy puntual con sus pagos. Admira  y agradece a sus compañeros de trabajo por la acogida que le brindaron y a su vez por los denodados esfuerzos que realizan con el afán de salir adelante.
Los 2,000 nuevos soles los destinará para la compra de una computadora el cual considera ella será una buena herramienta para un mejor desempeño como docente.
texts.en:
Marisabel, 35, is an independent and hard-working woman.  She has a son, Sebastian, who is four years old, who has been her motivation in many different areas.  Currently her employment situation allows her to rent a room for herself and her son.  Two years ago, she was working as a teacher, but was not able to continue because she did not have a degree due to financial hardships.  Thanks to the trust of MFP and with accessible loans, she was able to finish and at last work at what has always been her vocation in life.  She considers being a teacher one of the best things it is possible to chose since working with children makes you feel useful in society.   

However many inconveniences she faced, including the lack of organization and solution of the union problems, none were a motivation to dampen her wish to participate in education in her country.  One of her needs as a teacher is to acquire a computer since she thinks it is a necessary tool which will help her work as a teacher.  She will be more fluid in her work which will benefit her students.  

This is her fifth loan.  As a professional, she believes that a good example brings progress, so she has always been on time with her payments.  She admires and thanks her work colleagues for the welcome they have provided as well as the dedicated effort she has made to get ahead.  

She plans to use the 2000 nuevos soles from the loan to purchase a computer which she considers an important tool to improve herself as a teacher.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Sari Ayu Group

texts.en: Ni Luh wants to increase her bussines by keeping local pigs for pigroll (roasting). She needs new loan to purchase three local pigs and feed for the pigs. The pigs for pigroll are usually only kept for two or three months and are then sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her feed the pigs and clean the barn. Ni Luh saves her profit because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase local pigs for pigroll (roasting).

loans.name: Catarina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, 3 já frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante vende produtos diversos. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, feijão caldo, óleo, refrescos e outros) para reforçar e diversificar a sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja adquirir mobiliário para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o agravamento dos preços no mercado grossista.
texts.en:
Catarina is married and the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom already attend School, lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She is a trader and sells various products. With this loan she plans to buy products (rice, flour, beans, stocks, oil, sodas and others) to reinforce and diversify her stock.

In future she hopes to purchase furniture to improve the comfort of her family. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the increasing prices in the bulk markets.

loans.use: buy products (rice, flour, beans, stocks, oil, sodas and others) to reinforce and diversify her stock.

loans.name: Las Cochitas Group

texts.es: Las Conchitas es un grupo formado por 13 personas todas mujeres, esta ubicado en una pequeña comunidad que esta sobre carretera y enfrente de una presa de pesca, la comunidad se llama Concepción Chico, vulgarmente se le dice la concha, por esa razón como el grupo lo integran mujeres se pusieron las conchitas y ese el significado, varias integrantes van invertir su préstamo en comercio; Eleuteria inverira en su molino, Doña Modesta,Martha,  Maria, Margarita, Birginia, Beatriz, Maria Guadalupe ella invertiran en sus tiendas Liyezmin invertira en sus cinturones, Felipa invertira en caballos para el trabajo para el campo, Rosa invertira en papeleria y Valentina invertira en alimento para borregos. La representante del grupo se llama Ana Luisa, ella cria pollos para vender, y nos platica lo siguiente sobre su negocio: Yo me dedico a criar pollos y habeces guajolotes, ahora quiero invertir en comprar pollos y aprovechar para hacerle la casita a los pollos y tengan donde duerman y protegerse del clima, un problema que he tenido con los animales es que como no tengo donde se queden se van y despues ya no los encuentro y se me pierden, tambien vacunarlos y no se enfermen de gripa, va beneficiarme el prestamo porque tengo un hijo que esta en la primaria y puedo ayudarlo con algunos gastos de papeleria que seguido le piden, mi meta es hacer mi casa porque vivo en casa de mi mamá con mi señor, no soy casada vivo en union libre, mi esposo trabaja como albañil, pero primero quiero ahorrar para comprar un terreno y despues fincar, por eso quiero mi negocio y empezar a ganar aunque sea un poco para ir empezando.
texts.en:
“Las Conchitas” (The Little Shells) is a group that consists of 13 individuals, all women, who are from a small community that is located along the highway and near a lake where people fish. The community is called Concepción Chico, but commonly known as “La Concha” (The Shell). This explains why the women of the group called themselves “Las Conchitas”.

Several of the women will invest their loans in some type of trade: • Eleuteria will invest in her grain mill. • Doña Modesta, Martha, Maria, Margarita, Birginia, Beatriz, and Maria Guadalupe will invest in their stores. • Liyezmin will invest in belts. • Felipa will invest in horses for her farm work. • Rosa will invest in her stationery shop. • Valentina will invest in feed for her sheep.

The group representative is Ana Luisa. She raises chickens to sell and says the following about her business: “I devote my time to raising chickens and sometimes turkeys. Now I want to invest in the purchase of chickens and build a chicken coop where the animals can sleep and protect themselves from the weather. One problem that I have is that the animals have nowhere to stay, so I have lost a few since they cannot be contained. I also need to have them vaccinated so that they will not come down with bird flu. The loan will be a benefit because I have a son who is in elementary school, so I will be able to pay for a few of his school supplies. My goal is to build a house because my husband and I live at my mother’s house. I am not married, but we have a common-law relationship. He works as a bricklayer. First, I want to save toward the purchase of some land and then acquire a farm afterwards. It is for this reason that I started my business, so that I could begin earning some money to save toward these goals.”

loans.use: to buy chickens and to build a coop.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
Sari Mertha group has requested another loan from MUK. There are 10 group members and each member gets 1,500,000 IDR. These loans are used to support the efforts of raising pigs.

Ni Luh will use this loan to buy a superior quality sow. He has a plan to become a piglets seller. She already has a local sow and the piglets are usually raised for barbecue. The price today is IDR 450.000 per piglet. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Luh feeds the piglets with traditional feeds made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves. Ni Luh pursues this effort to support her family economy.

loans.use: To buy a superior quality sow

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a micro-finance member of PMPC. She is 42 years old and is married with 1 adult and 7 school-age children.  She lives in Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She engages in a sari-sari store (general store) business primarily selling basic commodities.  She has operated the business for 18 years having an average monthly earnings of PHP 2,000.  She took a loan through PMPC to purchase additional grocery stocks for sale.  She plans to use the profit to support family needs and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock for sale

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is from Poblacion, Bonifacio. She is 51 years old and married. To make a living, she manages a farm where she grows coconuts for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns PHP 1,000 a month for these activities. In 2011, Alejandra joined GDMPC. Alejandra is requesting a loan of  PHP 1,500 which will be used to buy seedlings to plant. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Harukooto Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Jane is a 62-year-old married woman with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is in the same group with Judith, who shared with us her story in the previous loan. Jane captured our attention by inspiring her group members to work hard and make their future better through her entrepreneurial skills. She has a grocery store where she sells a wide range of food items. With the money she earns she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her major challenge is lack of preservation equipment for the perishable goods. Her dreams are to operate a wholesale business and to buy a refrigerator. Jane will use her portion of the loan to buy sweet bananas and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sweet bananas and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Medard

texts.en: Medard is a twenty-seven-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been practicing agriculture for seven years and the sector is very lucrative since it is the major backbone of the economy. As agriculture is seasonal and cannot ably facilitate him to meet his day-to-day family expenses, he set up a retail shop. Price fluctuations and unpredictable seasonal weather changes are his major challenges; however, these not withstanding, he hopes to venture into modern farming methods, especially irrigating during the dry season. Medard is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his banana and coffee plantations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his banana and coffee plantations.

loans.name: Hermolisa

texts.en:
Hermolisa is an active individual member of PMPC since 2010. She is widowed with one adult-age child. For over five years, she has engaged in manufacturing candles for delivery in the province, with an average monthly income of 4,000 PHP. 

Hermolisa has taken out a new loan from PMPC in the amount of 40,000 PHP to purchase raw materials for manufacturing candles. She plans to increase her production and sales and to invest more capital in the business so she can save for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture candles.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy supplies like glass, aluminum materials, silicon, and other materials used in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and to help her meet her personal, household, and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy the same supplies: glass, aluminum materials, silicon, and other materials used in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carolina hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials like glass, silicon, and aluminum materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleny es una joven mujer de 22 años quien comparte una vida conyugal con Yuri de 26 años, ambos aun en calidad de pareja, tienen muchos objetivos. Habitan actualmente una casa de madera al cual alquilan a uno de sus familiares. Como mujer lidera y administra su hogar a manera de llevar las cuentas en correcto estado, desempeña actividades menores como servicios de lavado de ropa, limpieza de casas entre otros. Por otro lado Yuri quien con una mototaxi que es de su propiedad recorre diversas calles de su distrito brindando servicio de taxi, ellos vienen laborando de manera paralela desde hace 4 años. Dentro de las grandes prioridades que tienen actualmente es contar con una casa propia muy necesaria, pues considera indispensable para iniciar la formación de un hogar, pues uno de sus anhelos es que sus hijos no pasen las mismas necesidades que por que ella paso.
Dentro de sus posibilidades planean aprovechar la compra de un lote el cual se encuentra siendo ofertado y consideran es una buena ocasión en donde a futuro esperan realizar la construcción de una vivienda para desempeñar en ella un negocio propio. Este es su tercer crédito con el cual se siente comprometida desde ya para lograr culminar el pago del mismo sin inconvenientes. Considera el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal como una buena manera de acceder a créditos ya que la información y confianza priman de manera constante.
Con los 2,500 nuevos soles complementaran el dinero que se encuentra destinado para la compra de su futuro lote de terreno.
texts.en:
Marleni is 22 years old and married to Yuri, who is 26 years old.  Together as a couple they have many goals.  They currently live in a wood house that they rent from one of their relatives.  As a woman she leads and administers her home to keep the accounts correctly.  She also works providing services like laundry and house cleaning.  Yuri owns a mototaxi and travels around different streets in their district providing a taxi service.  They have been working together for four years.  Their priority right now is to have their own house, which they consider indespensible in starting to create their household.  One of their hopes is that their children don't have the same necessities that she passed by.  

They plan to purchase a plot of land that is being offered.  They consider this a good opportunity since in the future they plan to construct a home so that she can have her own business.  This is her third loan and she promises to make her payments without difficulties.  She thinks that the work within her community bank is a good way to obtain loans since there is information and constant confidence.

With this loan of 2,500 nuevos soles they plan to purchase their plot of land.

loans.use: to make the final payment on a plot of land.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine. She previously acquired a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy more school supplies for sale. The more items she can display at her store, the more she can attract customers and earn profits. This will help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josephine dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of school supplies and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Narantsetseg is a 46-year-old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in their own apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She had worked as a contract worker in Korea for several years. In 2006, she came back home and purchased an apartment. Now she operates a clothing store in the central city, a business she started almost two years ago. She purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. Months ago her daughter started to help her purchase products from Ereen. She said, "My customers are mainly young people. Sometimes I couldn’t understand world design. But my daughter makes good choices so that customers are always happy." Narantsetseg is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to improve her family's living conditions. Her apartment is upstairs. The roof is sagging. The wallpaper in all of the rooms is worn and has a musty smell. She wants to repair the roof and the walls. A comfortable apartment will create a warmer atmosphere and bring happiness to her family every single day.

loans.use: to repair her apartment's roof and walls

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Norma has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Norma is requesting a loan for PHP 11,000 from NWTF, which she will use to buy more clothing to sell.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa is a 40-year-old hardworking and innovative married man with three children, ages 12, 9,and 7. He lives in Kyenjojo,Uganda and earns a living from bicycle repairs and fitting services, a business he started after he dropped out of school due to lack of funds. He started the business to raise money to pay school fees for his children so that they can do better in life than he did. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house for the family's residence and a business goal of expanding his business to include all sorts of spare parts so as to bring services nearer to his customers and earn more money. Isa intends to use the loan to buy bicycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 42 years old, married  and has six children, ages 4 to 20. She lives in Antequera, Bohol and is engaged in basket weaving. She sells baskets made of nito, or native palm. Her husband is a carpenter who helps her finance the family's daily needs. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase nito (native palm) and wicker (hard-woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture). In the future, Elvira would like to invest in other ventures to support  her family as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy nito or native palm and wicker for basket-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El deseo de superarse es uno de los sueños mas importantes de este hombre que vive junto a su grupo familiar, el posee una venta de frutas y verduras, tomates, cebollas, platanos entre otros, ya tiene algún tiempo con el negocio y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, su venta es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor todos los días lucha por conseguir un futuro mejor con nuevos horizontes y alejado de la violencia social de la que es victima la localidad en que reside, día a día se esta esforzando al máximo pues esta feliz con su trabajo y no quiere decepcionar a su familia, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda pues cada vez hay mas personas que necesitan del producto, pero para mantener el buen servicio necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso  solicita  un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. El joven tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, se siente muy motivado por la oportunidad y asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda, y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá llevar a su pequeño hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The desire for self-improvement is one of this man’s most important dreams.  He lives with his family unit and sells fruit and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, bananas, etc.  He’s been in business for some time now and has gained valuable experience that allows him to earn good profits.  He’s very well known by locals and he has a large clientele that prefer him for his good prices and excellent service.  He’s an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work.  He strives daily to attain a better future with better horizons that are away from the social violence his community is prone to.  Day to day he strives to the maximum because he’s happy with his work and he does not want to disappoint his family.

Demand has increased in recent weeks because every day there are more people who need his product but in order to maintain the good service he needs to make an investment which is why he’s requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.  He has good payment references and is very responsible.  He feels very motivated by this opportunity and is sure that he’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time hopes to be able to provide economic security to his home.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and to buy firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
