texts.es: La motivación de superarse es uno de los sueños mas importantes de esta mujer que vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia, quiere tener un nuevo comienzo y dejar la vida de delincuencia que la rodea, siente que es una de las mejores decisiones que ha tomado y se siente orgullosa de eso, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace mas de tres años, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad del producto,  por los precios accesibles y sobre todo por el servicio excelente, es una mujer activa, emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, y con muchas metas que desea lograr, esta trabajando duro por alcanzar un futuro mas prospero y se siente muy contenta con el negocio. Hace tortillas al mediodía para el almuerzo y en la tarde para la cena, sus clientes dan muy buena referencia de ella y sus productos. En las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por lo que quiere realizar una nueva inversión, por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor y leña. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevará a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Motivation for self-improvement is one of the most important dreams of this young woman living with her family in her own house.  She wants to have a new start in life and leave behind the life of crime that surrounds her.  She feels this is one of the best decisions she’s made and feels proud of it. 

She’s been selling tortillas for more than three years now and  she’s acquired a large clientele that prefers her for the quality of her product, her good prices, hygiene and above all for the excellent service.  She’s an active, enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and with many goals to reach.  She’s working hard to attain a more prosperous future and feels very happy with her business.  She makes tortillas at midday for lunch and in the evening for dinner.  Her customers speak highly of her and her product.

In recent weeks demand for her product has increased and she needs to make a new investment which is why she’s requesting a loan to buy corn at wholesale and to buy firewood.    She has good payment references and is very responsible.  She assures that she’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time trusts that she’ll be able to provide her home with economic security.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and to buy firewood.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is from the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista, where almost everyone works in farming. Armando is a married man who is blessed with three children, two of whom go to school while the youngest is still an infant. 

For a year and four months, Armando has been raising hogs to be fattened. For ten years previously, he operated a cornfield. He is determined to succeed, send his children to a higher level of education, and earn a better way of living. He is borrowing 20,000 PHP. This loan will be used to buy hog feed and to maintain Armando's cornfield. 

Armando believes that his goal in life is attainable through hard work and the full support of his wife in running their livestock and farming business. Armando says he is inspired by people who succeed in life and business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and maintain his cornfield.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nyakitokoli Basubuzi Group

texts.en: Rose is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan. She is a fifty three-year-old married woman with seven children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  In order to raise money to take her children to good schools, she decided to start a retail shop.  Now three of them have graduated from university. She is also a farmer and mainly grows food crops. She faces hardships of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the high demand.  Her dream is a wholesale shop and buying more land for farming.  Rose intends to use the loan to buy salt, beer, soda and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, beer soda  and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jojit

texts.en:
This is Jojit, She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were used for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better.  More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jojit hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita, She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of rice for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of rice for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margarita hopes to have a grocery store someday and she hopes to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of rice needed in her business.

loans.name: Neolinda

texts.en:
Neolinda is a 50-year-old widowed mother of five children. Two of her children are in school.

Neolinda is in the agricultural business, farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Neolinda requested a PHP10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

Neolinda has been farming rice and vegetables for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Neolinda would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 42 years old and still practicing mixed-crop farming. He has been in the farming business for the past 21 years as his primary business. He also offers motorcycle service as his secondary business and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000 to support his family. 

Boniface bought fertilizer and seedlings with the previous loan. His farm did well and his income level increased. He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

Boniface will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Noeline's Group

texts.en:
Noeline's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Noeline is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Noeline has been working hard to manage her retail store, which sells posho, sugar, and soap. 

To help expand her business, Noeline has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to obtain stock for the shop, and will help Noeline to generate greater profits and support the parents. Noeline hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Noeline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to obtain stock for the shop

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, 2 já frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua irmã que vive com ela.
É policia e do quadro do Ministério de interior. Com este empréstimo pretende pagar suas propinas e material Escolar. 
No futuro deseja concluir com os seus Estudos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é estar saudável para poder efectivar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Antonio is married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom already attend School. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his sister who lives with him.

He is a policeman and a permanent employee of the Ministry of the Interior. With this loan he intends to pay his higher education fees and materials.

In future he hopes to complete his studies and to this end, he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to remain healthy so that he may carry out his plans.

loans.use: pay his higher education fees and materials

loans.name: William Enrique

texts.es:
William, soltero, 23 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad  de Granada, se dedica a vender queso, dulces y gaseosas. Comenzó con  solo 2 libras de queso fue ahorrando de poco a poco tuvo que trabajar de noche cuidando casas para conseguir más ingresos y comprar un carretón y vender queso por los vecindarios de la ciudad así fue  agregando más productos como dulces y gaseosas. Con lo que gana le ayuda a su mama con los gastos del hogar pues son una familia muy humilde. 
 Está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar queso, crema, gaseosas. A pesar de haber crecido sin su padre y solo con la figura de su madre , tiene una ganas inmensa de salir adelante y apoyar a su mama.
texts.en:
Wiliam is 23 years old, single, and resides in the city of Granada. He sells cheeses, candies, and sodas. William started out with only two pounds of cheese, so he began saving a little bit at a time and working nights taking care of houses in order to acquire more income. William was able to buy a cart and began selling cheeses in the neighborhoods of his city. Later on, he started offering other products, such as candy and sodas. With the money he earns, William is able to help his mother with the household expenses since they are a very humble family.

William needs a loan so that he can buy cheese, cream, and sodas. Despite having grown up without a father and only a mother to guide him, he possesses tremendous drive to move forward and support his mother.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make chocolate.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland is an active member of PMPC under the individual program.  He is single, and a resident of North Poblacion, Larena, Siquijor.  He operated a beauty salon business for over three years, having a monthly average income of Php 6,000.  He took another loan from PMPC in the amount of Php 40,000 to purchase additional beauty equipment for the new beauty salon outlet to open.  He plans to expand the business to increase his profit to save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty equipment

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 58 years old.  She is married and a mother of nine children, one of whom is in school.

Herminia is in the agricultural business, farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Herminia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Herminia has been farming rice and vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Herminia would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Mujer con éxitos y fracasos pero con la idea de mejorar su vida y la de sus hijos. Ella reside con su grupo familiar en la que viven junto a ella 4 de sus hijos que son mayores de edad y colaboran en los oficios del negocio, residen en una zona con alta violencia social del país, Todos los días deben lidiar con ella para no verse arrastrados y afectados por tal situación, para esta mujer es muy importante contar con el negocio porque gracias a ello sus hijos permanecen ocupados, siendo personas económicamente activas para la sociedad y alejadas de la violencia social que actualmente somete a los jóvenes en actividades delictivas y drogas. Para esta mujer su familia es la razón de que se esmere para brindarles lo mejor. Se dedica a vender frutas y verduras desde hace algún tiempo es conocida y se ha hecho de buenos clientes que la buscan por su manera de atender y por la variedad de su mercancía, adicional a esto posee un carrito con venta de tortas que le ayuda a complementar los gastos del hogar. Actualmente ella tiene el deseo de mejorar su puesto de trabajo y continuar así apoyando a sus jóvenes hijos, para que también tengan fuentes de empleos junto a ella. Es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así poder comprar tomates, cebollas, chiles, plátanos, entre otros. Esta segura que con la ayuda recibida podrá brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos y también tiene la esperanza en Dios, que pronto saldará la deuda adquirida. Agradece de ante mano la ayuda que recibirá, cuenta con la satisfacción de que es muy capaz de realizar todo aquello que se proponga.
texts.en: [This is a] woman who has had successes and failures, but who has the idea of improving her life and that of her children. She lives with her family group of four adult children, who work with her in her business.  They live in an area with some of the highest social violence in the country. Every day they must cope with it in order not to be pulled in and affected by such a situation.  It is important for her to have a business because it keeps her children occupied, and participating in the economic activity of society and free from the social violence, criminal activities and drugs that nowadays overwhelm the youth.  Her family is the reason why she strives to offer them the best. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for some time. She is well known and she has acquired good customers who seek her out for her good way of serving them and the variety of her merchandise. In addition to this, she has a little cart for selling cakes, which helps her cover the household expenses. Now she wants to improve her workplace, and therefore continue supporting her children so they can have job opportunities in the future like her.  This is why she has come to INTEGRAL to apply for a loan and thus be able to buy tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, and bananas, among other items. She is sure that with the help she receives she will be able to offer a better future to her children, and she also has hope in God that she will soon pay off the debt she acquires. She gives thanks in advance for the help that she will receive. She has the satisfaction that she is very capable of doing everything that she proposes.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 57 años trabajadora y emprendedora, tuvo la lamentable perdida de su esposo hace pocos años, ahora viuda y madre de Lenin de 27 años a quien toda su vida inculcó valores y principios y gracias a ello es un muchacho trabajador y honrado. Habita actualmente una casa de material noble en calidad de alquiler. Llegada desde el oriente del país tuvo el deseo de conquistar a través de la cocina nuevos sitios, es así que hace 5 años lidera con gran orgullo su restaurante de comidas típicas el cual expende diversos platos oriundos de la selva, cuya sazón y sabor son únicos hasta el momento logrando obtener una buena acogida y permitiendo ganarse el cariño de la gente generándole buenas ganancias. No obstante, las cuentas a crédito que solicitan algunos de sus comensales le ocasionan un retraso considerable para el pago del mismo.
Dentro de sus prioridades inmediatas esta el de contar con una congeladora adicional para conservar sus ingredientes y carnes de manera clasificada, esto con el fin de brindar a sus clientes una mejor calidad de servicio.
Por el momento sus anhelos están refugiados en su negocio, por lo que necesitará ampliar su restaurante para abarCar más clientela. Este viene a ser su octavo crédito, agradecida como siempre considera que es una buena manera de salir adelante trabajando con créditos. Se siente muy cómoda por la manera en como viene desempeñándose su banco comunal ya que la responsabilidad y  el respeto han primado desde que se integrÓ al grupo.
Con los 2,000 realizará la compra de una congeladora con el cual planea brindar un mejor servicio a sus comensales.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working and enterprising fifty-seven-year-old woman.  She had the sad loss of her husband a few years ago and is now a widow.  She is the mother of twenty-seven-year-old Lenin and has instilled values and principles in him all his life.  Thanks to that, he is a hard-working and honorable man.

She currently lives in a house made of quality and noble material that she rents.  Arriving from the eastern part of the country, she wished to conquer new places through cooking.  For five years she has been the proud leader of her restaurant of typical foods.  She sells diverse plates native to the rainforest, whose seasoning and flavor are unique.  She has managed to be well-received, allowing her to win the love of the people and thereby generating good profits.  Nevertheless, the accounts on credit of her guests cause a considerable delay in payment.

One of her immediate priorities is to have an additional freezer to preserve her ingredients and classified meats.  This will offer her customers a better quality of service.  For the moment, her desires are all in relation to her business and in what she will need to grow her restaurant to be able to accomodate more customers.  

This will be her eighth loan.  She is thankful, as always, and thinks that working with loans is a good way to continue moving forward.  She feels very comfortable with the way in which the communal bank carries itself out; responsibility and respect have always prevailed since she joined the group.

With the 2000 PEN, she will buy a freezer and be able to offer a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Faustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de condimentos, tejido de polainas, tejido de medias, venta de material escolar, venta de juguetes, confección de centros, confección de centros, confección de ropa, venta de CD’s, carpintería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Faustina es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de un familiar que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió desde hace diez años atrás conjuntamente su familia posteriormente ella decide realizar su negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para equipamiento (compra de maquina) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras posteriormente lo implementará en su empresa para la elaboración de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el préstamo y el consultorio de la institución.

En fotografía no se encuentra la señora Toribia ya que se encontraba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
The "Hormiguitas" Communal Bank will begin its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch regional office. The bank is made up of ten members and is run by a board of directors, of which Faustina is president. The businesses which the bank's members run are varied. Among them are the sale of food, condiments, school supplies, toys, and CDs, as well as knitting legwarmers, making centerpieces, tailoring, and carpentry.

The requested loan will benefit small business owners in the bank of which Faustina is a member. She joined Pro Mujer nine years ago, through the invitation of a relative who is a partner of the institution. She currently has a carpentry business. She says that she launched this business ten years ago along with her family, but later she decided to develop the business independently.

The loan which she will take out is for equipment (the purchase of machinery), which she will obtain from distribution companies and implement in her business, in order to make her products. This line of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, since she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the loans and the advice from the institution.

Note: Toribia does not appear in the photo because she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: To buy machinery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and clear his fields.

loans.name: Ntuntu Tukwatanize Group

texts.en: Bonifance is a 32 year-old married man who has four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a retail shop where he has spent five years.  This has helped him to earn income which he has used to educate his children. Bonifance also does farming.  He grows Irish potatoes especially.  He has always reaped tangible benefits and he even used these profits to start the retail shop. He has a challenge of customers not paying on time.  His business plan is to expand to new areas and buy more land for farming. Bonifance is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.  Some of the members in his group did not take the loan but as it is a group policy they had to guarantee their members in order to access credit.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
This is Tomasa. She previously accessed an 26,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 26,000 PHP for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Tomasa hopes to expand her business and dreams to give a good life to her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is 46 years old and married.  She has three children.

Susanita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Susanita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farm. Susanita has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Pedro de 57 años padre de 7 hijos, se dedica a la panadería desde hace 31 años originario de Patzicia y ahora vive en la ciudad de Guatemala, se ha especializado a elaborar el mejor pan de su colonia donde vive, su esposa que día a día le ayuda a vender y a distribuir el pan en las diferentes zonas de la ciudad: Se ha esmerado  a trabajar con dedicación para el desarrollo de su familia tiene 5 hijos casados y 2 solteras; profesionales ya solo le falta que la más pequeña pueda graduarse de alguna profesión se siente satisfecho porque sus sueños se están cumpliendo pero aun sigue trabajando fuertemente para poder ahorrar cuando sea más grande y las fuerzas ya no le ayuden aunque tiene esperanza que sus hijos puedan darle lo mejor y pueda  salir adelante agradece a Dios y FAPE por el apoyo que le ha brindado promete trabajar con responsabilidad el crédito obtenido.Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de arina y ingredientes para la elaboración de pan.
texts.en:
Pedro, 57 years old and the father of seven children, has made a living in a bakery for 31 years.  He's a native of Patzicia and now lives in the city of Guatemala.  He has specialized in making the best bread in his neighborhood.  Every day his wife helps him sell and distribute the bread in different areas of the city.

He has made the effort to work with dedication for his family's growth.  He has five married children and two single daughters who are professionals.  Only his youngest daughter has yet to graduate with a profession.  He's satisfied because his dreams are coming true.  He still continues to work hard, though, to be able to save for when he's older and no longer has the strength.  Although he hopes his children can give him the best and he can get ahead.

He's grateful to God and to FAPE for the the support they have given him.  He pledges to work responsibly with the loan.

He's requesting this loan to buy flour and ingredients to make bread.

loans.use: to buy flour and ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel who previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan used to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Raquel dreams to be able to give her all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle. She has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from food vending. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, who previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan used to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan . She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nida hopes her business will continue to succeed in the coming years and hopes to give a good future to her family. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Martine Rachel

texts.fr: martine est une  femme de 49 ans célibataire, mère de 2 enfants qui vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 23 ans ou elle commercialise les vivres frais (tomates, poivrons, et piment...) en fonction des saisons. Cette activité lui permet de nourrir sa petite famille et de subvenir à leurs besoins quotidiens. son activté fonctionne normalement, mais ne rapporte pas beaucoup parce qu'elle achète sa marchantise en détail pour la revendre. grace à ce crédit, Elle pourra augmenter le stockdes cajots de tomates. ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle économisera une partie de ce benefices pour la scolarité de ses enfants et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activté pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Martine, age 49, is a single mother of two children who go to school. For the past 23 years, she has been selling fresh seasonal produce (tomatoes, peppers, etc.) at a market in the capital. This activity allows her to support her family and to provide for their daily needs. The business is running smoothly but is not very lucrative as she has to buy her stock at retail prices. 

She will use this loan to stock up on crates of tomatoes. This will help her to increase her sales and her profit margin. Part of the profits will be set aside for her children’s tuition, and the remainder will be reinvested in her activity for future expansion.

loans.use: to stock up on crates of tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel has a two month-old baby, and now she is a mother of four children. She still practices dairy farming, which she has done for the past two years.  She earns a monthly income of 16,000 Kenyan shillings (KES )from the farm products.

Rachel has requested a second loan of KES.30,000 to purchase another cow and chickens to raise. She anticipates using the profit to repay her loan as well as to purchase more cows. She would like to see her farming expand and be a renowned farmer in this region in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and chickens to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El deseo de superarse es uno de los sueños mas importantes de un hombre que vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia en una zona de alta incidencia de violencia social y delincuencia, no quiere que se vean afectados por la difícil situación de violencia que podría arrastrarlos, por eso siempre los mantiene ocupados incorporándolos a su actividad productiva, es una de las mejores decisiones que ha tomado y se siente orgulloso de eso, se dedica junto a sus jóvenes hijos a la venta de minutas de diferentes sabores, comercian de forma ambulante en su carrito de venta mobil y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto, por los precios accesibles y sobre todo por el servicio mas rápido, es un hombre activo, emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, y con muchas metas que desea lograr, esta trabajando duro por alcanzar un futuro mas próspero y en paz para toda su familia. Se siente muy contento con el negocio pero sabe que necesita hacerlo crecer a fin de salir de la pobreza. En las últimas semanas ha aumentado la demanda, por lo que quiere realizar una mayor inversión en la compra de los insumos necesarios para realizar su producto, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un nuevo carrito que usará uno de sus hijos beneficiándolo con un empleo que le brinde mejores ganancias y se motive a buscar actividades de bien y cubrir la demanda que hacen sus clientes, también comprará hielo por mayor, saborizantes y jaleas. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevará a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The desire to improve is one of this man’s most important dreams.  He lives with his family group in a house he owns in an area of high social violence and crime.  He does not want to see his children affected by this difficult situation of violence, and so he keeps them occupied by having them work in his business.  This is one of the most important decisions he’s made; he’s proud of this.

He works, together with his children, selling shaved ice in various flavors.  They sell from place to place with his mobile sales cart and has many customers that prefer them for the quality of their product, their affordable prices and above all for the quick service.  He’s an active, enterprising man who is dedicated to his work and who has many goals he wants to reach.  He’s working hard to attain a more prosperous future for his family.  He feels very happy with his business but knows that he has to make it grow if he’s to rise out of poverty.

Demand has increased in recent weeks so he’d like to invest in the purchase of necessary ingredients to make his product which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy a new cart for his son to use so he can work and earn more income and be involved good activities as well as meet the demand of his clients.  He will also buy ice at wholesale, flavoring agents, jellies.  He has good payment references and is very responsible.  He assures that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time trusts that he will be able to bring economic security home.

loans.use: to buy ice at wholesale and to buy flavoring agents.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una de las personas que sabe ganarse la vida a base de esfuerzo y dedicación a sus 56 años comparte una linda vida de pareja con Alejandro con quien logró regalarle a sus hijos hoy ya mayores una educación  que les permite llevar una gran vida independiente. Habita una vivienda de material noble que se encuentra en proceso para lograr ser la propietaria. Es poseedora de un puesto el cual alquila dentro del mercado modelo de su localidad para desempeñar su negocio consistente en un bazar de ropa para damas y niños. Lleva 10 años en el rubro ganando muchos amigos y conocidos que hacen una buena referencia de su negocio.
Una de las cosas que le fascina  es orientar a su clientela en la elección de las prendas que adquieren haciendo de su negocio muy divertido. Aunque en ocasiones se le agotan las prendas de vestir que solicita a sus proveedores provocándole la perdida de algunos clientes.
Debido al notar un incremento en las ventas mensuales tiene planeado solicitar un pedido de prendas al por mayor con el fin de lograr abastecerse logrando así satisfacer a su clientela quienes la estiman mucho por poseer un buen gusto en la elección de las prendas. Este viene a ser su quinto crédito, se siente muy conforme por la manera en como ha ido desempeñándose con sus créditos con el cumplimiento responsable del caso. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizara la compra de mercadería consistente en prendas de vestir para damas y niños, dentro del cual priman los polos y las blusas que ella misma selecciona.
texts.en:
Martha is one of those people who knows how to earn a living through effort and dedication. At the age of 56, she shares a beautiful life with her spouse Alejandro, with whom she succeeded in giving their children, who are now adults, an education that would allow them to live a good, independent life. They live in a well-constructed house which is in the process of becoming their own. She is the holder of a stall that she rents in the model market of her area so that she can operate her business, which is a shop for women's and children's clothing. She has been in this business for 10 years, making many friends and acquaintances who give good references for her business.

One of the things that intrigues her is counseling her customers in the selection of clothing that they might purchase, which makes her business very enjoyable, although sometimes she runs out of the items that she orders from her suppliers, causing her the loss of some customers.

Thanks to noticing an increase in monthly sales, she is making plans to place a wholesale order for clothing, with the goal of stocking up and thus satisfying her customers, who admire her very much for her good taste in the selection of clothing. This is going to be her fifth loan. She is very happy with the way she has been performing with her loans and with her responsible discharge of  them. With the 1000 PEN, she will purchase merchandise consisting of clothing for women and children, among which priority will be given to polo shirts and blouses that she herself will select.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts and blouses

loans.name: Gulnihol

texts.ru: Гулнихол  молодая женщина в возрасте 23 лет.   Замужем, имеет двоих  детей.  Занимается она откармливанием скота у  себя дома. Этим видом деятельности она занимается с юности, ее научили ее родители.  Сейчас в  наличии она имеет 6 голов мелко рогатого скота.  Ее муж тоже старается ей помогать но в основном он воспитывает своих детей.  Животноводство это их единственный доход, поэтому Гулнихол старается развивать свой бизнес. Она знает все преимущества этого бизнеса.  На полученный кредит Гулнихол хочет купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Gulnihol is a 23-year-old young woman. She is married and has two children. She in involved in the feeding of livestock at her home. She has been involved in this activity since her youth, which her parents taught her. She now has a stock of six heads of cattle. Her husband also tries to help her, but he mostly raises their children. Livestock farming is their only income, so Gulnihol is trying to develop her business. She knows all the advantages of this business.  With the receipt of the loan, Gulnihol wants to buy cattle and livestock. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es: Las socias son microempresarias emprendedoras formadas por tres socias, Claudia su negocio es fritanga y comida hace almuerzos por encargos actividad que viene realizando desde hace 5 años es casada y tiene un hijo mayor el cual le ayuda en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo verduras, productos perecederos etc.  Merali también vende fritanga en su domicilio y María vende artesanía de cemento como hongos, comedor de cemento etc.
texts.en: The members of this group are micro-entrepreneurs, which is formed by three partners, Claudia is one of them. Her business is food preparation; she makes “Fritanga” [Nicaraguan typical food] and lunches to order for the last 5 years. She is married and has a grown son who helps her with the business. She will utilize the loan to invest in the purchase of staple grains such as rice and beans and also to purchase cooking oil, beef, chicken meat, vegetables, perishables, etc. The other two partners are Merali who works at home, also selling “fritanga” and Maria who sells handcrafts made of cement such as mushroom sculptures, dining room furniture, etc.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains such as rice, beans, cooking oil, beef, chicken meat, vegetables and perishables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Es una mujer muy emprendedora que su mayor deseo es entregarle un mejor futuro a su familia queriendo tener nuevos horizontes y olvidarse de la delincuencia de la que están siendo victimas principalmente los jóvenes del sector donde reside, ello la preocupa dado que tiene hijos jóvenes. Su familia siempre ha sido la razón por la cual se esfuerza día a día, es muy trabajadora y desde hace muchos años se dedica a la confección de carteras, billeteras, maletines entre otros productos de tela, cuero y materiales sintéticos, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este trabajo y se siente orgullosa porque ha logrado que le dé buenos resultados, tiene mucha clientela en un lugar que identifico como muy bueno para desarrollar sus actividades; con estos ingresos ella le brinda el pan de cada día a su familia. Pero ahora su deseo no es sólo llevar sustento a su hogar sino crecer con su negocio, incorporando a sus jóvenes hijos al negocio que posee, a fin de que posean una fuente de empleo que les genere ya un ingreso económico mas de ellos.  Ella tiene la convicción de que si aumenta su producción así aumentarán las ventas, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor, cueros, zipers o cierres, etc. Agradece la colaboración anticipadamente que recibirá y tiene esperanza en Dios que nunca la abandonará para que a ninguno de los miembros de su familia se vean influenciados por malas compañías y estar siempre ocupados en obras buenas como éstas y así ser ejemplo para la sociedad de como se pueden hacer bien las cosas.
texts.en:
She’s a very enterprising woman whose greatest wish is to provide her family with a better future; she wants new horizons that are free of the crime in which the principle victims are the youth who live in her area.  She worries because she has young children.  She has a family group she strives for daily.  She’s very hardworking and for many years has been making wallets, purses, satchels and other thread, leather, and synthetic material.  She’s been in this business for several years now and feels proud because she’s attained good results.  She has a large clientele in a place she indicated is very good for developing her activities.  With this income she’s able to provide daily bread for her family.

Now her wish is not only to provide for her home, but also grow her business by incorporating her children into her work resulting in more job opportunities and more income for them.  She’s convinced that as production rises to too will sales which is why she approached Integral to request a loan to buy fabric at wholesale, leather, zippers, etc.  

She gives thanks in advance for the collaboration she’ll get and trusts that God will never abandon her so that none of her family members will be influenced by bad companions and that she’ll always be occupied in good works like these and therefore be a good example for society.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesle, leather and zippers.

loans.name: Elvis Kevin

texts.fr: Elvis est un homme de 26 ans, marié sans enfant. Il a ouvert une alimentation qu'il gère depuis 15 mois.Grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et son accueil chaleureux et son rapport avec son voisinage,il a pu acquérir une très grande clientèle. L'augmentation croissante de sa clientèle rend son offre inférieure à la demande d'ou l'importance de ce crédit dans son activité.Grâce à lui il pourra augmenter le stock des produits de premières nécessités (riz, savon, sucre,cube...) ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle, d'augmenter ses ventes ainsi sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Elvis is 26 years old, married, and has no children. 

He opened a grocery shop 15 months ago and was able to build a very large customer base thanks to his experience in the field, the warm welcome he gives customers, and his rapport with his neighbors. This loan is important for his business because the growth of his customer base makes it hard for him to meet consumer demand.

With this loan, he will be able to increase his inventory of food staples (rice, soap, sugar, bouillon cubes...), and this will allow him to satisfy his clientele and increase his sales and margins. He will reinvest part of his income in his business and he’ll use the rest to meet his own needs.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of food staples (rice, soap, sugar, bouillon cubes...)

loans.name: Aida Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Aída tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos. Reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Doña Aída tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembre de café y granos básicos (maíz y fríjoles) para la venta.
Actualmente ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  10,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra para la limpieza de la finca y cultivos.
Considera que si le brinda el mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivos, obtendrá mayor producción y sus ingresos aumentaran. 
Ella tiene como meta proporcionarle los recursos necesarios para la educación secundaria a sus 2 hijos fuera del municipio.
texts.en:
Aida, 31, lives in a common law union with her husband and has two children.  She lives with her family in a rural community in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara Department.  She’s been working in agriculture for four years, especially growing coffee and basic grains (corn and beans) to sell.

She’s asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay labor costs to clear her fields and weed crops.  She believes that if she provides good crop maintenance she’ll obtain better crop yields and her income will increase.  Her goal is to provide necessary resources for her two children to attend secondary school away from their community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene de 28 años comparte una vida de pareja al lado de Huicho, ambos aun sin hijos vienen desempeñándose laboralmente con el objetivo de cumplir muchas metas a largo plazo. Hasta hoy ya son poseedores de una casa construida a base de material noble. Ella se dedicada a actividades agrícolas menores así como la administración de  los fondos que ingresan al hogar gracias a su pareja quien con una mototaxi recorre diversos puntos de su localidad desde hace 5 años. Lograron adquirir el vehiculo con un dinero que fue producto de mucho esfuerzo y hasta hoy ha sido muy útil para sustentarse de manera satisfactoria. Tiene pensado a futuro iniciar en el local habilitado dentro de su domicilio un negocio consistente en la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros para de esa manera expandir su economía que permita cumplir otros objetivos mas adelante. Este es su segundo crédito con el cual se siente muy agradecida por la confianza que le brindan, a su vez se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con todas sus cuotas de manera puntual. Se siente muy contenta por la manera en como se viene desempeñando su banco comunal en conjunto ya que considera es un buena manera de solicitar créditos de manera grupal.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizarán la adquisición de un moto taxi, para continuar brindando el servicio de taxi sin inconvenientes y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Rene is 28 years old and lives by the side of Huicho, her life partner. They are both still childless, and are working to get themselves out of debt with the objective of fulfilling many goals in the long run. They own a house built from quality materials. She works doing lesser agricultural tasks such as administration of the funds that they invest in their home, thanks to her partner who has been covering diverse places in town with his rickshaw for the past five years.

They were able to acquire the vehicle with some money produced through great effort, and until now it's been very useful as a means of sustaining them in a satisfactory manner. She has it in mind for the future to start a business in a designated place in the home, selling mens and women's clothing in order to expand their finances which may allow them to fulfill other objectives further on.

This is her second loan and she feels very grateful for the confidence granted to her. For her part she is committed to punctually making the repayments. She feels very happy about how her communal bank as a whole is getting itself out of debt, and she believes that soliciting a group loan is a good way of doing things. With the 2,000 nuevos soles they will make the purchase of a rickshaw in order to continue providing a taxi service without inconveniences, and to have more income.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: Suma Chuyma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA CHUYMA”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: sastrería, venta de muebles, carpintería, venta de comida, bordados de mantas, venta de fruta, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de una socia que participa en una banca comunal. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió desde hace años atrás conjuntamente ya que el hermano de su esposo le enseño este oficio, ya que ella salía a vender los productos acabados.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de muebles) que adquirirá de las personas que ponen en desuso sus muebles posteriormente los repara y los comercializa en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras las capacitaciones de las asesoras y del área de salud.

En la fotografía no esta presenta la señora Vicky a causa de razones culturales.
texts.en:
The community bank "Suma Chuyma" will begin it's 9th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Germán Busch. It is composed of 9 members and is directed by a board of which Martha is the President. The businesses that the members of the community group run are varied, and among them we have: tailoring, selling furniture, carpentry, selling food, embroidering blankets, selling fruit, selling shoes.
The loan that they are requesting will benefit small businesspeople such as Martha. She points out that it is three years since she joined Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of a member who participated in the community bank. She currently has a business selling furniture. She tells us that she started this business years ago jointly with her husband's brother who taught her the work and she went out to sell the products that had just been made. 
The loan that she is requesting now is to increase her business capital so she can acquire furniture from people who no longer want it, repair it, and then sell it in the markets in the city of El Alto. This work enables her to generate income to support her family economically as she is married and has four children.
When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes sharing the training and health information with her friends.
One of the members, Vicky, is not in the photo due to cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Santo Domingo" y  se integra de tres señoras quien cada una tiene su diferente actividad y vive un pueblo llamado Tecpatan que esta a una hora de Copaínala.

  La señora Normaida, es quien se  le tomo la entrevista es ama de casa, está casada con el señor Luciano, y con quien procreo cinco hijos, 3 ta estan casadoos y 2 todavía están a su responsabilidad; de casada lleva treinta años, ella se casó muy joven, de 15 años de edad y comenta que es muy feliz.
 
   Normaida, se dedica a la elaboración de tamales desde hace tres años dice que le va bien ya que el préstamo le ayuda a comprar los insumos que utiliza para la elaboración, en ellos compra: hoja de guineo, carne, pasas entre otros ingredientes más, así su clientes le puedan compra con más amino.
 
   Ella elabora los tamales y sale  a vender de casa en casa y a repartir  a los clientes que le encargan y es así como puede obtener los ingresos y las ganancias de su negocio.

   Desde muy joven ella trabajaba por eso no le parece nada malo trabajar así, piensa que es un trabajo bonito ya que así conoce mas gente.

   Quienes integran el grupo son las señoras: Araley  invertir el préstamo en la compra y venta de zapatos de la marca terra y la señora Rosalinda invertirá en la compra y venta de café y cacao.
texts.en:
This group is called "Santo Domingo," and it is formed by three women who have different businesses. They live in a town called Tecpatan, which is an hour from Copainala.

Señora Normalda, who was interviewed, is a housewife. She is married to Señor Luciano, with whom she has five children. Three are already married, and two are still her responsibility. She has been married for 30 years. She married very young, at the age of 15, and she comments that she is very happy.

Normalda has been making tamales for three years. She says that it is going well for her, since the loan helps her to buy ingredients that she uses to make them. She buys banana leaves, meat, and raisins, among other ingredients. Thus her customers can buy from her with more enthusiasm.

She prepares the tamales and goes out to sell them from door to door and to deliver them to customers who order them, and this is how she can obtain income and earnings from her business.

She has worked since she was very young, and so she doesn't see anything bad about working like this. She thinks that it is nice work, since she meets many people.

The other members of the group are Señora Araley, who will invest the loan in the purchase of shoes of the Terra brand to sell, and Señora Rosalinda, who will invest in the purchase of coffee and cacao to sell.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Carlos Andrey

texts.es: Carlos, un hombre emprendedor y muy humilde, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su familia actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad y factible a la hora de ser comercializado. Este  agricultor que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a logrado encaminar su proyecto hasta el día de hoy, y este como tal, gracias a su dedicación ha respondido favorablemente, se encuentra en uno de los mejores de la zona y la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo y dando alegría a todo su familia ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace solicitud de un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos is a humble, enterprising man.  He’s 32-years-old, single and lives with his family at present.  He requested the loan hoping to buy supplies like manure and insecticide.  He wants to provide coffee crop maintenance aiming at keeping it in good condition during growth so that his harvest will be of good quality and command good prices at sales time.

With much effort and sacrifice, this grower has been able to move his project forward to date and thanks to his dedication the crop has responded favorably.  He’s one of the best in the zone and his only limiting factor is the lack of money to continue growing and providing joy for his entire family since this is the economic activity they all depend on to continue  moving ahead.  This is why he’s requesting a loan from the foundation and it’s his first from Fudecosur.  He has no other loans with state banks and Fudecosur has offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay laborers.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Estelí el diamante de las Segovia de esta bella ciudad de donde es originario el señor Eduardo un hombre esforzado con gran visión de sacar adelante a su honorable familia que esta compuesta por su compañera de vida y sus tres hijo de los cuales dos en edad escolar, también tiene bajo su cargo a su progenitora.

El nivel escolar de Eduardo es técnico superior electricista ,pero debido al poco empleo que se presenta en nuestro país, el tiene que desempeñarse como agente de seguridad  ya que es una alternativa para ganar el sustento diario de su familia, como el trabajo lo realiza día de por medio le permite realizar algunos trabajo extra de electricidad para si obtener otros ingresos.

El objetivo del crédito es para la compra de piedra cantera, cemento y arena ya que necesita construir una cerca perimetral en su vivienda ya que le urge la construcción de esta cerca ya que en varias ocasiones ha sido víctima de algunos ladrones.
Esta construcción le dará una mayor seguridad a su familia y por ende tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Estelí the diamond of the Segovia, this beautiful city is home to Mr. Eduardo, a man who works hard and is determined to give his honorable family a good start in life. His family is made up of his life partner and three children, two of which are of school age; he also cares for his mother.

Eduador’s educational level is that of a master technical electrician but due to poor job offerings in the country he has to work as a security guard since it is an alternative to support his family daily. Since the job is done during the day, he is able to pick up extra electrical jobs to get more income.

The loan will be used to buy quarry stones, cement and sand to build a perimeter fence around his home because he has been a victim of some robberies.

The construction will provide his family more security and peace of mind.

loans.use: buy construction materials like quarry stones, cement and sand.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carlos Noé

texts.es:
El señor Carlos tiene 30 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 1 hijo. Reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del Municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira.
Carlos tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de accesorios y repuestos para teléfonos celulares, además vende controles remotos para televisión de todo tipo.
En la actualidad ha solicitado  un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de más producto: cargadores para celular de tipo universal y para vehículo, baterías, protectores para teléfono celular.
Él manifiesta que tomo el préstamo con el fin de mantener surtido el negocio y aprovechar así la temporada navideña, que es donde las ventas aumentan mucho.
texts.en:
Carlos, 30, is in a common law union with his wife, he has a son.  He lives with his family in a community in Gracias municipality, Lempira Department.  Carlos has been selling accessories and spare parts for mobile phones and also sells all types of TV remote controls.

He’s currently asking for a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy more merchandise like universal and car mobile phone chargers, batteries and mobile phone cases.  He states that he took out the loan in order to stock the business and take advantage of the Christmas season which is when sales increase a lot.

loans.use: to buy batteries, TV remote controls, cell phone chargers and cases.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson Lujan de 37 años un hombre de ardua dedicación y trabajo tiene como compañera de vida a Edy de 33 años con quien tiene 2 alegrías que son sus hijos Juan y Juliana de 6 y 3 años, actualmente viven en una casa de material noble que alquilan para comodidad de sus pequeños. Aprovechando una gran habilidad para la pintura al detalle y elaboración de letreros Wilson viene brindando el servicio de publicidad desde hace 15 años, ofrece sus servicios a negocios y comercios quienes conocedores de su buen trabajo confían en sus anuncios. Esto le valió para convertirse en proveedor del municipio de su localidad dirigido en la elaboración de avisos para construcción de obras y gestiones.
Se siente muy contento con su labor debido a demostrar aptitud en su trabajo, pues desde niño siempre tubo habilidad con los colores.
Dentro de sus prioridades necesita cumplir con algunos pedidos que tiene en pendientes a cumplirse por falta de insumos para la elaboración de letreros el cual planea cumplirlos en el plazo establecido.
A futuro desea aperturar una tienda dedicada a la venta de pinturas y matizados de todo tipo esto con el afán de cumplir uno de sus más anhelados sueños. Este viene a ser su segundo crédito con MFP con el cual se siente motivado así como agradecido por la confianza brindada, Considera a su banco comunal como un grupo muy unido que motiva a trabajar de manera conjunta ante cualquier situación.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles tiene planeado adquirir insumos como pinturas industriales y otros para cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Wilson Lujan is 37 years old.  He is a dedicated and hard-working man.  His life partner is Edy, 33 years old.  Together they have two children, Juan and Juliana who are 6 and 3 years old.  They currently rent a house made of real wood for the comfort of their children.  To take advantage of his skills painting details and making letters, Wilson has provided advertising services for 15 years.  He offers his services to businesses and shops who know of his good work and trust his ads.  This earned him a job with his town making warning signs for construction and administration. He is very happy with his work since he shows an aptitude for it.  Since he was a child, he has had skills with colors.  

One of his priorities is to finish some orders that he had in progress until he ran out of supplies to make letters.  He plans to finish them in the appointed time.  In the future he would like to open a store dedicated to paints and hues of all type.  This would be the realization of one of his dreams.  

This is his second loan with MFP, which motivates him since he is thankful for the confidence provided.  He considers his community bank to be a united group that is motivated to work together in any situation.  With the 3000 nuevos soles requested he plans to purchase supplies such as industrial paints and other items to successfully complete the orders he has pending.

loans.use: to purchase industrial paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor, pedals, brakes.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is married and has a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 24 years. She works hard to support her family.

Rosalyn is requesting her second loan from NWFT for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stock to sell such as seasoning, sugar, and canned goods.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
El señor Teófilo tiene 41 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 6 hijos. Reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Teófilo es agricultor, produce granos básicos y café. 
Con el fin de generar mayores ingresos para su hogar, hace tres años que logro establecer un negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de canasta básica familiar: harina, arroz, fríjoles, manteca, sopas instantáneas, condimentos y  medicamentos de uso común.
La esposa de Teófilo apoya atendiendo la clientela en la pulpería como una forma de contribuir también a la economía familiar.
Con el fin de surtir mas su negocio ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de más alimentos: arroz, fríjoles, manteca, productos de limpieza, refrescos y golosinas.
Él espera lograr que sus hijos estudien en una buena escuela y que su negocio crezca para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 41, lives in a common law union with his wife and has six children.  He lives with his wife in a community in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara Department.  Teófilo works in agriculture growing coffee and basic grains.

In order to generate additional income, three years ago he opened a grocery store where he sells basic staples like rice, flour, beans, lard, instant soups, condiments and common use medicines.  Teófilo’s wife helps him take care of customers in the grocery store as a way of helping contribute towards family economy.

In order to better stock his store, he’s requested a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy more merchandise like rice, beans, lard, cleaning supplies, soft-drinks and snacks.  He hopes his children will attend a good school and that the business grows to move his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Freddy Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Señor  Freddy tiene 27 años de edad, convive con su esposa  en unión libre,  reside en compañía de sus 2 hijos y esposa  en  el municipio de Azacualpa, Departamento de Santa Bárbara.
Freddy anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de pan de manera ambulante, pero desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de agua purificada en botellones de 5 galones y en bolsas de medio litro, además vende refrescos de diferentes sabores.
Con el propósito de mejorar y aumentar sus ventas, ha solicitado un préstamo por  la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de más producto: agua purificada y refrescos. La comercialización la realiza a través de las pulperías donde él tiene contrato de abastecedor.
Tiene por meta la de crecer como comerciante individual y darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Freddy, 27, lives in a common law union with his wife.  He lives with his two children and his wife in the town of Azacualpa in Santa Bárbara Department.  He used to work selling bread from place to place but a year ago started selling purified water in five gallon bottles and in half-liter bags; he also sells soft-drinks in assorted flavors.

Aiming at improving and increasing sales, he’s requested a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy more merchandise: purified water and soft-drinks.  He sells through grocery stores where he’s contracted to be their supplier.  His goal is to grow as an individual merchant and to provide better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy five-gallon bottles of water, 1/2-liter bags of water and assorted soft-drinks.

loans.name: Leti Yolani

texts.es:
La señora Leti tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, reside en compañía de sus dos hijos en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de Villanueva, Departamento de Cortés.
Leti  trabajaba como supervisora de calidad en una fabrica maquiladora, pero la fabrica cerro y con el dinero que recibió de sus prestaciones laborales decidió establecer un negocio de pulpería desde hace un año.
En el negocio ella vende granos básicos (arroz, frijoles y maíz), refrescos, condimentos, carnes, lácteos y embutidos.
Se vio motivada a establecer dicho negocio para lograr estabilidad económica y dar un futuro digno a sus hijos.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de una vitrina para exponer achinería para la venta.
Ella manifiesta estar muy agradecida con ODEF Financiera y KIVA por la oportunidad y confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Leti, 37, is a single mother living with her two children in an urban community in Villanueva, Cortés Department.  Leti used to work as a quality control supervisor at an assembly plant but it closed down and with the money she got from her severance pay she decided to open a grocery store a year ago.  She sells basic grains (corn, beans and rice), soft-drinks, condiments, meats, dairy products and canned goods.

She was motivated to start this business to attain economic stability and provide a dignified future for her children.  She states that she’s very grateful to ODEF and to KIVA for the opportunity and for the trust placed in her.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Poderosas De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PODEROSAS DE JUAN PABLO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, costura de chamarras, venta de queso, costura de carteras, tejido de polainas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de unas amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió con la orientación de una amiga que le enseño paso a paso la forma de comercialización de estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso) que adquirirá de las personas que elaboran posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
The community bank "Poderosas de Juan Pablo" will begin their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Collpani and is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board of which Virginia is the President. The businesses that the members of the community bank run are varied, and among them we have: weaving blankets, making jackets, selling cheese, making portfolios, and making traditional leggings. 
The loan that they are requesting will benefit the small business people such as Virginia. She points out that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for years and that she was invited by some of her friends who were members of the institution. She currently has a business selling cheese. She tells us that she began this business with the guidance of a friend who taught her step by step how to sell these products.
The loan that she is requesting now will be used to increase her capital so she can buy products from people who made them earlier and then sell them in her business premises. This form of work enables her to generate income to support her family economically as she is single and has 4 children. 
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the health trainings.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les sept femmes du groupe Balimaya  ont  en moyenne 40 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente  de condiments,  de céréales et des articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  intègrent Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame,  Sali Issa (première debout avec foulard noir) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 200 kg de soja    auprès des producteurs dans son village, afin de faire du Sounbala de très bonne qualité. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en demi gros aux forains  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame sali espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group Balimaya are married women who average 40 years of age and eight children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Niazekan, in the region of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and through ties of marriage and kinship. They buy and sell condiments, cereals, and various other products. 

To bolster their working capital, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Sali Issa (standing, and wearing a black scarf) plans to use her loan to buy 200 kg of soy from local producers in order to make high quality Sounbala (a type of condiment). She sells wholesale for cash to a customer base consisting of fair goers (men and women). 

With this loan, Sali Issa expects to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000FCFA, which she will use to cover the needs of her household and to reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy soy to make sounbala.

loans.name: Kanipa

texts.ru: Канипа 61 год, замужем.Канипа и ее муж являются пенсионерами. Канипа входит в группу инвалидов.Канипа имеет высшее образование. Она закончила Политехнический институт по специальности инженер механик. Она проработала старшим инженером механиком в местном колхозе в течении 22 лет. После развала Советского Союза, и приватизации коллективных хозяйств, в 1996 году Калипа с мужем начали собственный бизнес с начальным капиталом в сумме 3,000 KGS. Сегодня благодаря старанием Канипы ежемесячный доход хозяйства составляет 8000 KGS.В данный момент Канипа со своим супругом занимается разведением скота и полеводством.На сегодняшний день у Калнипы во владении имеется 2 га земли, где ежегодно сажают картофель, сеют пшеницу. По мимо земли в хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы 5 баранов. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Канипа обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота по более низкой цене для откорма и последующей реализации. В планах у Канипа улучшение благосостояния семьи, а в будущем планирует сделать капитальный ремонт дома и расширить хозяйство.
texts.en: Kanipa is 61 years old and married. Kanipa and her husband are pensioners. Kanipa is disabled. Kanipa has higher education. She graduated from the polytechnic institute with a specialty in mechanical engineering. She worked as a senior mechanical engineer at a local collective farm for 22 years. After the collapse of the Soviet Union and the privatization of collective farms, in 1996, Kalipa and her husband started their own business with an initial sum of 3,000 KGS. Today, thanks to the care of Kanipa, the monthly income of the household is 8,000 KGS. currently, Kanipa and her husband are involved in breeding livestock and crop agriculture. At this moment, Kanipa possesses two hectares of land where they annually plant potatoes and sow wheat. Apart from the land, she has two cows and five sheep. In order to further expand her business, Kanipa appealed to the organization Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 40.000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle at a lower price, for feeding and resale. Kanipa has plans to improve the welfare of her family, and in future plans to do a major overhaul of her house and expand her household.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for raising and future resale.

loans.name: Solidario El Roble Group

texts.es: Solidario El Roble. este grupo está conformado por la señora Amalia de 34 años de edad, originaria de Antigua Guatemala,ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de avon, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, a luchado dia a dia para sacar adelante a su familia, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de cosmeticos de avon ya que sus ventas han aumentado y nececita más capital para trabajar espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Amalia, is a member of the group Solidario El Roble. She is 34 years old and a native of Antigua, Guatemala.  She has been selling Avon cosmetics for five years.  She has struggled day in and day out to help her family get ahead.  

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase Avon cosmetic products. Given that her sales have increased, she needs additional funds in order to continue her work.  She hopes this loan that she requested will help.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun is 38 years old, married and has four children, three of whom attend school.  She is a weaver and her husband is a construction worker. They also grow rice during rice farming season. The family lives along Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Savoeun is requesting a loan for $600, which she will use to purchase a water pumping machine instead of renting one.

loans.use: to purchase a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Desde los 10 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, su padre fue quien le enseño. Después de que se caso, tenía más deseos de trabajar, pues comenzaba una nueva vida para su familia. Él se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a darles de comer a sus caballos, a sus pollos ya que tiene una granja. Luego se toma una taza de café. Posteriormente, se traslada al lugar donde tiene sus cultivos, trabaja ahí unas ocho horas, regresa a su casa a las 2:00 p.m. a almorzar. Por no tener los suficientes recursos económicos no puede pagar quien le ayude con sus cultivos; solo su esposa le ayuda.
