Ordeñar sus vacas, luego sale a dejarlas al terreno para que coman y él se toma una taza de café y se lleva su comida al trabajo que esta a treinta minitos de su casa; ahí trabaja durante ocho horas, para regresar a su casa a almorzar e ir a recoger los animales al terreno. Todo este trabajo él lo hace con el firme deseo de que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario para vivir y desarrollarse. 

Para adquirir los insumos para sus cultivos, él debe trasladarse a pie, para abordar el autobús que lo conduce a la ciudad, el recorrido tarda unos cuarenta y cinco minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 sacos de abono, un galón de foliar y dos litros de herbicidas. Con la inversión, podrá aplicar el abono a su cultivo de fríjol y maicillo, ya lo tiene cultivado y solo le hace falta fertilizarlos. Lo que él desea, es trabajar para ahorrar y comprarles un terreno a sus hijos para que construyan su casa, debido a que donde viven no es de ellos. Desea que sus hijos se preparen económicamente y que mejoren su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 49, is married and has two children.  He’s worked in agriculture since the age of 10; his father taught him.  Once he got married he wanted to continue working since he was starting a new life for his family.  He rises at 4am to feed his horses and chickens since he has a farm.  He then drinks a cup of coffee and heads out to where his crops are growing and works there for about 8 hours. He returns home at 2pm to have lunch.  Because of his limited economic resources the he can’t pay staff to help him with the work; his wife’s his only helper.

To milk his cows.  He then goes out to leave them at pasture so that they can eat and he drinks a cup of coffee and takes his lunch to work which is thirty minutes away from his house.  He works there for 8 hours and returns home to have lunch and bring the animals back from pasture.  He does all this work with the firm desire that his children have everything necessary to live and grow.  

To acquire the supplies for his crops he must walk to catch a bus that takes him to the city; the trip takes about 45 minutes.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy four sacks of manure, a gallon of leaf fertilizer and two liters of herbicide.  With this investment he will be able to fertilizer his bean and sorghum crops which are already growing but he still needs to fertilizer.

What he wants is to work to save up and buy land so his children can build their house because where they live now is not theirs.  He wants his children to prepare themselves economically and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of manure, a gallon of leaf fertilizer and two liters of herbicide.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Concepción  tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos, reside en compañía de un hijo en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Concepción anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de golosinas, hace 5 años que su hermana le dejo como herencia una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios: huevos, refrescos, carnes, lácteos y productos de limpieza (jabón, detergente, trapeadores, escobas y cloro).
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de manteca, sopas instantáneas, alimentos enlatados, medicamentos de uso común y golosinas. Ella espera que al tener surtido su negocio sus ventas aumentaran ya que se avecina la temporada navideña.
Doña Concepción desea que su negocio crezca para poder descansar un poco ya que toda su vida ha trabajado.
texts.en:
Concepción, 62, is a single mother of six children.  She lives in the company of one of her sons in an urban community in San Pedro Sula, Cortés Department.  She used to sell snacks and five years ago her sister passed down to her a grocery store where she sells food items: eggs, soft-drinks, meats, dairy products and cleaning supplies (soap, detergent, mops, brooms and chlorine bleach).

She’s currently asking for a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy lard, instant soups, canned food, common use medicines and snacks.  She hopes that by having her store well-stocked her sales will increase since the Christmas season is approaching.  Concepción hopes her business will grow so she can rest a bit after working her entire life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Yessica María

texts.es:
La señora Yessica  tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, reside en compañía de sus hijos en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de pimienta, Departamento de Cortés.
Jessica anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de tortilla, hace 8 años que decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, zapatos, sandalias, accesorios para damas y a la venta de ollas y utensilios de cocina.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de utensilios de cocina (ollas, freideras y cucharones), ropa para caballeros y damas y accesorios (aretes, collares, binchas)
Ella tiene la meta de trasladar su negocio a un lugar más céntrico, donde haya mayor afluencia de clientes y además lograr tener su propio local.
Jessica manifiesta estar satisfecha con el apoyo financiero de Kiva a través de ODEF Financiera.
texts.en:
Yessica, 30, is a single mother of two children.  She lives in the company of her children in an urban community in Pimienta, Cortés Department.   Jessica used to work selling tortillas and 8 years ago decided to sell women’s and men’s clothes, shoes, sandals, women’s accessories, pots and kitchen utensils.

She’s currently asking for a 25,000 Lempira loan to buy kitchen utensils (pots, pans and ladles), men’s and women’s clothes and accessories (earrings, necklaces and hairbands).  Her goal is to move her store to a more centrally-located spot where there are more passersby and also to have her own locale.  Jessica states that she’s very satisfied with the financial support from Kiva and ODEF.

loans.use: to buy clohtes and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Fredis Armando

texts.es:
Fredis, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita fortalecer el negocio con mas capital de trabajo, él invertirá en madera y pintura para la fabricación de muebles, esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones del negocio y sus ventas.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, con los recursos económicos y obteniendo mejores ingresos, con lo que ha podido ayudar a su familia, su negocio se mantiene; al igual que su familia.
texts.en:
Fredis is requesting a new loan because he needs to strengthen his business with more working capital.  He plans to invest in wood and paint to make furniture, which will allow him to improve the conditions of his business and his sales.  

His last loan helped him strengthen his business with financial resources and earn more income, which he has used to help his family and maintain his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and paint to make furniture.

loans.name: Nestora

texts.en: Nestora is a 55 year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She raises hogs. Aside from hog raising, she is engaged in a fish vending business. She sells fish in her community. She has been in both  businesses for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP4,000 to purchase additional piglets, feeds and fish net. Her husband is a fisherman helps her sustain the family's source of food. Nestora would like to expand her business to invest in other business ventures to support her family for a sustainable livelihood in the coming future.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds, fishnet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various supplies for performing beauty makeovers.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: El Sr. Joel tiene la edad de 34 años es casado y tiene 2 hijos el trabaja como como cobrador de una mueblería y su esposa se dedica alas labores del hogar en esta ocasión el sr Joel esta solicitando esta ayuda para hacer el cambio de instalación eléctrica en su hogar y así el principal cambio que tendrá será manos pago en el de luz ya que con la instalación que tiene gasta demasiada por la cual tiene que limitarse por cubrir el recibo de luz desea contar con el apoyo de esta institución.
texts.en:
Joel is 34 years old. He is married and has 2 children. He works as a bill collector in a furniture store and his wife devotes herself to caring for their home. At this time, Joel is soliciting this help in order to change the electrical system at his home, so that the main change that will occur will be lower payments for lighting.

The system he currently has costs too much. As a result he needs to tighten his belt so he can pay the light bill. He hopes this institution will help him.

loans.use: to upgrade his electrical installation

loans.name: Mercedes De Jesus

texts.es:
Mercedes, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital para trabajar en la compra y venta de pollos, con los fondos prestados e invertirá en pollos pequeños para aumentar la granja y continua vendiendo, esto será un gran apoyo para que continúe en la granja.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que le ayudó a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias que obtuvo ha podido ayudar a su familia, su negocio continúa creciendo y las condiciones en su familia se mantiene.
texts.en:
Mercedes has decided to take out a new loan because she needs more capital to continue working buying and selling chickens.  She will use the borrowed funds to buy chicks to increase the size of her farm and continue selling.  This will be of great help for her to continue with the farm.

She believes that the previous loan was very helpful because she strengthened the business and with the profits she obtained was able to help her family.  Her business continues growing and her family condition is stable.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Dúo Fuentes De Luz Group

texts.es:
DUO FUENTES DE LUZ 

ESTA FORMADO POR LA SEÑORA ELICIA ELLA TINE 34 AÑOS DE EDAD ES UNIDA TIENE 2 HIJOS MENORES LOS CUALES ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA SU NEGOCIO ES UNA MINITIENDA  DONDE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD TIENE 4 AÑOS DE TENERLA Y ELLA SOLICITA A FAPE LA PUEDA APOYAR PARA BRINDARLE SU CREDITO YA QUE SU SUEÑO ES TENER UN NEGOCIO MAS GRANDE, ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CRÉDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD.
texts.en:
Dúo Fuentes de Luz was includes Elicia. She is 34 years old and in a relationship. She has 2 young children who attend school. 

Her business is a convenience store where she sells staple food products. She has had her shop for 4 years and is asking FAPE to help her by providing this loan. Her dream is to have a bigger business. She is asking for this loan to purchase staple food products.

loans.use: to purchase staple food products.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 58 years old.  She is married and has seven children. One of her children is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.
Salvacion has a business selling rice in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more rice to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for ten years. Salvacion would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clay, firewood, dye and to pay transport costs.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan originario de Granada, de oficio de sastres, acompañado, es padre de 3 hijos,  de 13, 17y19 años de edad respectivamente. Actualmente esta  estudiando uno nada más. Juan se dedica  a la costura de pantalones y tiene un vendedor que sale fuera de Granada además de vender en la propia ciudad. 
 A el le gustaría dar a conocer su producto en todo el país, ya que es un pantalón de muy buena calidad .ampliar mas la producción de pantalones comprando mejores equipos que le ayuden a trabajar mejor.
Este capital  lo requiere para poder comprar más telas, hilos, botones, zippers, elásticos etc, para poder hacerle frente a la demanda de trabajo  de pantalones que le hacen los clientes. Su objetivo es cumplir con todos los pedidos y asi ampliar su clientela, ofrecerles un buen producto de calidad.
texts.en:
Juan is originally from Granada, has a tailor's office, and is in a relationship.  He is the father of three children, ages thirteen, seventeen, and nineteen respectively.  Currently, only one of his children is studying.  

Juan makes a living in sewing pants and has a salesperson that goes outside of Granada in addition to selling in the city itself.  He would like for his product to be known throughout the whole country, since it is a pant of very high quality.  He would like to increase his production of pants and buy better equipment to help him work better.

He requires this loan to be able to buy more fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, elastic bands, etc. so that he can meet the demand for his work with pants that his clients ask of him.  His objective is to meet all the requests and thereby grow his customer base, offering them a good quality product.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers, and elastic bands.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
This is Rhodora, 52, a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Dionisio, a worker abroad, and is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  Rhodora is a pedicab operator. She has one unit of side car or bicycle cart that carries up to two passengers to their destination within the community. Someone who uses her pedicab will just give her the rental for the day. She also has a variety store and a direct-selling business. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of her side car. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  Rhodora hopes to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their pedicab unit.

loans.name: Wisaf

texts.en:
Wisaf, who appears in the picture with her husband, is a 44-year-old woman.  She is a mother of two sons and five daughters who are are between 22 and 15 years old. Wisaf's husband is a worker who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's need.
Currently, Wisaf is repairing and renovating her house. But due to a money shortage, some renovations have been stopped for awhile. So she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to continue her home's renovations. First of all, she will paint her house and then install new windows. The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to covering the cost of painting and hiring workers to install new windows to her house, which will offer suitable home conditions to Wisaf and her family.

loans.use: To paint the house and install new windows

loans.name: Kiryantaama United Group

texts.en: Mary used the previous loan to buy fresh foods to sell. She is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Mary sells fresh foods and maize flour, a business she has operated for 11 years. Her major challenge has been inadequate capital to inject in the business and her dream is to have a big food store. She is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, casava  and salt to sell.

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELES”  iniciará el decimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de mantas, venta de telas, librería, venta de cosméticos, macramé de mantas, venta de pan, venta de fierro, confección de deportivos, venta de perfumes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de laminas y cuadernos) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la orientación.
texts.en:
The “Claveles” (Carnations) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.   It has nine members led by a governing board presided by Amalia.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of business among which are blanket weaving, fabric sales, bookstore, cosmetics sales, macramé blanket making, bread sales, metal sales, sportswear making and perfume sales.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small, micro businesswomen like Amalia.  She indicated that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for three years having joined thanks to an invitation from a program promoter who visited her at home.  She currently has a bookstore that she started on her own initiative several years ago.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy notebooks and laminated sheets from suppliers to then sell in her sales point.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family economically since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the guidance.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and laminated sheets.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 36-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has six children. She is engaged in basket weaving. She sells native baskets made of nito or native palm. She has been in the basket weaving business for five years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy nito (native palm) and wicker (hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material usually used for baskets or furniture). Jocelyn would like to improve her business in order to support her family and save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy nito and wicker

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 27-year-old young man. He is married and a father of one son. His wife is a housewife and he is employed but earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the costs.

For the past four years, Tareq has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and a second source of income for the family, but also needs more support to cover the costs from time to time.

Tareq is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary spare parts for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi capacity to work extra hours and enable Tareq to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

Tareq is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José, tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un hijo de un año de edad, tienen casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja en lo propio, aprendió desde muy joven con su padre.
El esta iniciando la siembra, solicita un préstamo para la compra de comprara seis sacos de abono, los cuales aplicara a la siembra para poder fortalecerla y obtener una mejor cosecha.
La aspiración de José es que a través del préstamo pueda mejorar sus cosechas y que le permita mejorar sus ingresos económicos para sacar a su familia adelante, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José, 36, lives with his wife and one-year-old son; they own a house.  He works in agriculture and is his own boss.  He learned from his father while still very young.  He’s starting a planting cycle and needs a loan to buy six sacks of manure to apply to the crops to strengthen them and obtain a better harvest.  His hope is that by means of the loan he’ll be able to improve his harvest thus improving his income to move his family forward improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of manure.

loans.name: Kiryanjagi Twimukyangane Group

texts.en: Joy is a married woman, age 36, living in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years, she has been running a restaurant. She got the initial capital from brick laying, a business she still does. Inadequate capital is affecting the business while her dreams are to venture into new markets and own a hotel. Her personal dream is to see her children graduating with degrees since she did not have a chance of going to the university. She is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other to access a loan. Joy is requesting the loan to buy food for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is 32 years old, married to Dolphine and blessed with one child who is seven years old. He is a blacksmith who ventured into the business world seven years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

He has requested a second loan of KES 60,000 to purchase more scrap metal for use in his shop. The profit made will aid him to expand this business and save any remaining amount. 

His dream is to succeed in his business to be able to sustain his family.

loans.use: To purchase metal for use in his shop

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en: Constancia is an active member of PMPC under the individual program. She is 57 years old and married with three adult-age children.  She operates a sari-sari store business selling a variety of grocery products and feed. She has been engaged in the business for one year with a monthly average earnings of PHP 15,000. She took another loan from PMPC to purchase additional grocery stock and feed to sell. She plans to invest more capital in the business and to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products and feed to sell

loans.name: Gonzalo Armando

texts.es:
Gonzalo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la productividad de los granos básicos, pues está iniciando la siembra de maíz y ajonjolí, comprara abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada, para comenzar la milpa.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus cosechas de granos básicos, ya que le facilito los materiales para aplicarlos y de eso dependió la producción, con esa cosecha mantuvo para la alimentación de su familia, hasta la fecha se mantienen en buenas condiciones y buena salud.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is requesting a new loan to invest in the production of basic grains because he is starting to plant corn and sesame.  He will buy organic fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds in order to start the crop.

The previous loan helped him improve his basic grain harvests.  It helped supply him with the materials to apply to the crops, and production depends upon this.  With this harvest he fed his family, and to date they are in good condition and good health.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
This is Paula, 59, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to George, an aircon technician and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Paula operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Paula dreams of having a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Besiki

texts.en:
Besiki is 48 years old and lives in Telavi, Kakheti region, East Georgia. He has a large family: a wife, two sons (22 and 17 years old), a daughter-in-law and an infant grandchild. Besiki requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Besiki worked as a taxi driver and transported people from Telavi to the capital city. A storm and hail damaged his car and he has stopped working. The only source of the income for the family is his wife’s small salary from a kindergarten. It is hardly enough for food for a six-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Besiki requested a loan from Credo to re-start the family business (taxi service) that was stopped recently because of a natural calamity (storm damage). His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Besiki will purchase a car. He will be able to continue working as a taxi driver and serve the local people. This business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comestibles,el socio tambien trabaja en una construccion civil,su esposa es la atiende el negocio de venta de comestibles,juntos quieren salir adelante,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio de venta de comestibles y en su trabajo ya tiene 7 años,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de comestibles.El socio solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

El socio esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a pagar los cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to earn a living selling foodstuffs. He also works in civil construction. His wife looks after the business of selling foodstuffs. Together they hope to move forward successfully. The borrower has been in the business of selling foodstuffs for six years now, and has worked at his job for seven years. 

His dream is to expand his business selling foodstuffs. He is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale. He is happy to have a loan and is committed to repaying in installments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir nuevamente, comprándose frutas y verduras frescas, así como tambien pescado, esto permitirá que Víctor ofrezca mejor calidad y en frutos más variedad en manzanas, bananas, cebollas, tomates, y tambien mariscos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtuvo mejores ingresos, sus condiciones en su familia han mejorado, pero necesita continuar  trabajando  para  mantener las condiciones.
texts.en: Victor decided to take out another loan out of the need to invest again, buying fresh fruits and vegetables, as well as fish. This will allow Victor to offer better quality [products] and a greater variety of fruits, including apples and bananas, as well as onions, tomatoes, and also seafood. The previous loan helped him to increase his inventory and obtain better earnings. His family's living conditions have improved, but he needs to continue working to maintain those conditions.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, onions, tomatoes, and also seafood

loans.name: Gs Nueva Vision Group

texts.es:
La señora Martina de 55 años de edad, vive con su conyugue en su casa de habitación, ubicada en una comunidad al sur de Honduras,  se dedica a la  actividad que es: la venta de fresco y un molino de moler maíz, se dedica al negocio desde hace 15 años  en su casa de habitación,  sus clientes son los todos los vecino de la comunidad. 
Doña Martina solicita el préstamo para comprar  frescos y repuesto para su molino. Con el préstamo espera tener mejores ganancias, ya que los últimos meses del año son cuando mejoran sus ventas.
Doña Martina con el apoyo de este préstamo  desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir creciendo al igual que sus demás compañeras de grupo quienes se dedican a la venta de tortillas, nacatamales, pan y alfarería, ellas son Doña  María Y Doña Hilda residentes en la misma comunidad.
Doña Martina su sueño es tener el negocio mas surtido de la comunidad y brindarles mejor atención a sus  clientes.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Martina, age 55, lives with her husband in their own home that is located in a community in southern Honduras. She sells soft drinks and also has a mill for grinding corn. Martina has been in business for 15 years and works from home. Her customers are all of her neighbors from the community.

Doña Martina is requesting a loan so that she can buy soft drinks and spare parts for her grain mill. With this loan, she hopes to generate better earnings since the final months of the year are when her sales usually improve.

With the support of this loan, Doña Martina plans to continue investing in her business and growing alongside her fellow group members. Doña María and Doña Hilda are residents of the same community and earn their living by selling tortillas, Nicaraguan tamales, bread, and pottery.

Doña Martina hopes to have a business that is well-stocked for her community so that she can provide better service to her customers.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – October 2012

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and spare parts for her grain mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replant his coffee fields.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz, se le presenta la oportunidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para surtir la tienda de productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, y otros artículos, esto hará que Luz mantenga un negocio mas surtido.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio de la venta de medicina, incrementando el inventario para obtener mejores ventas con los clientes, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado con relación al crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Luz has the opportunity to continue investing in the business which is why she’s asking for a loan to stock her store with basic staples like beans, rice, sugar and other items allowing Luz to have her store better-stocked.

The previous loan helped her strengthen the business with the purchase of medicines increasing inventory to obtain better sales with the customers.  Her economic conditions have improved in relation to the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh seafood, fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Solidario Orquideas Group

texts.es: Solidario Orquideas. este grupo está conformado la señora Olga tiene 41 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, desde hace 7 años se siente muy contenta ya que su negocio esta prosperando, está solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para la elaboración y venta de tortillas espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Solidario Orquideas [Orchid Solidarity]. 

Forty-one year old Olga is a member of this group. She is married and has three children. For the past seven years she has earned a living making and selling tortillas. She is very pleased because her business is thriving. 

She is requesting this loan to buy corn that will be used to make and sell tortillas. She hopes you can help with the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy corn to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 23-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. Due to his desire to become self-employed he started a retail shop; he also deals in mobile money services, Godfrey believes his community benefits from his business in a very positive way because the service he provides is faster than other money transfer services and more often has sufficient cash to pay out receiving customers.

When Godfrey receives his loan he will be able to increase his float money (electronic and cash value of his working capital), thereby enabling him to satisfy more customers and also buy beer and mineral water to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and mineral water to sell and increase his float money.

loans.name: Radio San Gabriel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RADIO SAN GABRIEL”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de mantas de vicuña, producción de sacos, tejido de polainas, tienda de barrio, hiladora, librería y fotocopiadora, producción de chicharrones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió desde hace años atrás conjuntamente su familia posteriormente ella decide realizar su negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora Sofía ya que estaba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
Radio San Gabriel Communal Bank will start its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members and headed by a board of which Paulina is the director.  The diverse business of the members of the communal bank include making vicuña blankets, making bags, weaving leggings, neighborhood store, spinning, bookstore and photocopying, and making cracklings.

The loan they're getting will benefit a group of small business entrepreneurs to which Paulina belongs.  She says she joined Pro Mujer three years ago on the invitation of a facilitator who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business making blankets.  She says she started this business three years ago with her family and later decided to work on her own.

The loan she's getting now is to increase her capital buying wool, which she'll get from distribution companies.  After production, she'll sell in the markets in the city of El Alto.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, because she's married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says she likes sharing with her colleagues.

Sofía isn't in the photograph because she had a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Roba Corazones Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROBA CORAZONES”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mercedes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda múltiple de barrio, tejido de mantas, costura de chamarras, venta de coca, costura de edredones, venta de muebles, venta de tela.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mercedes es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de una de sus familiares que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de telas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente con su suegra hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito rápido.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank,"ROBA CORAZONES (Heart Breakers)," will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  The group has nine members and is headed by a board where Mercedes is the President. The members of the community association are involved in various businesses such as: running multiple neighborhood stores, weaving blankets, sewing jackets, selling coca leaves, sewing quilts, selling furniture, and selling fabric.

The requested loan will be used to benefit micro-entrepreneurs such as Mercedes.  She indicates that nine years ago she joined Pro Mujer by invitation of one of her relatives who is a member of the institution. Today, she has a business selling fabrics.  She has undertaken this business jointly with her mother for several years.
 
The requested loan is to increase her capital (by buying fabric) that she will acquire from distribution companies.  She will later sell the fabric in her retail space. This workflow allows her to generate resources to support her family financially because she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mercedes replies that she likes the fast credit.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de 21 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual s e caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se pueden apreciar muchos atractivos turísticos, los cuales son muy visitados en cualquier época del año. Julio vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y quien le brinda todo el ánimo y el apoyo para seguir adelante. En su tiempo libre a Julio le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, pero le encanta también comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”.

Julio trabaja cada día con mucho empeño en una empresa como operario, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, pintura, arena fina, entre otros, con lo cual realizara mejoras en su vivienda, principalmente arreglos de las paredes que se encuentran resquebrajadas; de esta manera tendrá un mejor ambiente para vivir y seguirá esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Tener su casa propia y tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Julio, 21, is a young man living in the city of Pisco noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Many tourist sites are also here that receive visitors year-round.  Julio lives with his wife who is his right hand and who provides him with all the encouragement and support needed to get ahead.  In his free time, Julio enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors but also loves to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious Duck with Rice.

Julio works very hard every day as an employee in a firm; he works about 9 hours daily and is able to cover household expenses this way.  He’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the great help they’ve provided him, he’ll be able to buy building materials and supplies like cement and fine sand, among others, to do some home improvements, particularly repair the cracked walls.  In this way, he’ll have a better living environment and will continue striving to reach his greatest dream: to own a house and have his own business.

loans.use: to buy cement, fine sand and other building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nylon thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old, married and has nine children. One of her children is in school.

Maria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria has been raising pigs for 17 years and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet's group is comprised of  hard working women. Juliet is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her retail store where she sells soap, sugar and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy other commodities to stock in her store such as sugar and cooking oil and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and to shore up the family. Juliet hopes that in the future, she hopes the business gets bigger. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy other commodities to stock in her store such as sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arooz,azucra,leche y aceite al por mayor.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member is still working in her grocery store business. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8am to 10pm. She has been working in this business for eight years and it is going very well. 

Zoraida is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale. She is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Mechita

texts.es:
Doris, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora. Está casada con Armando quien es policía, fruto de esa unión tienen un hijo de 12 años de edad, que son lo mejor que le ha dado la vida.  Vive en una bonita casa que logró construir con la ayuda de su esposo. La actividad que realiza Doris consiste en la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para eso abrió una bodega en su casa.  También   se dedica a la venta de vestuario policial, la confecciona en su pequeño taller, que se encuentra instalado en su propia casa, es así que este trabajo lo prepara previamente por pedido de sus clientes. Se inició en éste negocio gracias al poder relacionarse en el ambiente policial, ya que su esposo es policía en actividad, haciéndose de esta manera muy conocida  y solicitada por el buen acabado de sus trabajos, dedicándose a ésta actividad  hace más de 05 años, y realzándola sola.
Tiene planes de poder ampliar su bodega y aumentar su stock de mercaderías, como bebidas gasificadas, golosinas y otros productos comestibles. Este sería el  préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP, se siente bien con el trabajo de su banco comunal, y desea poder seguir contando con este apoyo, seguirá siendo puntal en sus pagos y así tener un buen record crediticio para tener acceso a más prestamos.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de productos para abastecer su bodega, asimismo en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Doris, 40, is a cheerful, very hardworking woman.  She’s married to Armando who is a police officer.  She has a 12-year-old son.  They are the greatest gifts life has given her.  She lives in a pretty house she managed to build with her husband’s help.  

Doris’ activity is selling basic staples; to do so she opened a store at home.  She also sells police uniforms that she manufactures in her small workshop also located at home.  She does this work based on prior customer orders.  She started in this business thanks to being involved in the police environment since her husband is a police officer in active duty.  She’s become very well-known and sought-after because of the fine finishing touches she puts into her work.  She’s been doing this work for five years and she does it alone.

She plans to enlarge the store and increase her stock of merchandise like soft-drinks, snacks and other food items.  This would be her 5th MFP loan and she feels good with the work in her communal bank and wants to continue counting on this support.  She will continue to be punctual with her payments to have good credit history and be able to access more loans.  She will use the entire requested 3,000 new soles to buy products to stock her store as well as articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plants and fertilizer and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao, se dedica a la venta de calzado, tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos quienes están estudiando bachillerato, tiene un puesto de venta de calzado en el centro de la ciudad, tiene 5 años de experiencia, realiza las ventas junto a su esposa quien le ayuda, trabajan de lunes a domingo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos para dama, en variedad de estilos y colores, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios para aprovechar que se acerca una temporada de mayor demanda.
La aspiración de Estanislao es fortalecer mas el negocio, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Estanislao, 43, makes a living selling footwear.  He lives with his wife and they have two children who are undertaking academic studies.  He sells shoes in a stall downtown.  He has five years of experience.  His wife helps him sell; they work from Monday through Sunday.

He's requesting a loan to buy women's shoes in a variety of colors and styles.  This purchase will help him increase his inventory to take advantage of the demand of the season.

Estanislao's goal is to strengthen his business more so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes

loans.name: Dúo Esmeralda Group

texts.es: Dúo Esmeralda. Este Dúo esta integrado por la señora Ernestina Graciela,es madre y tiene una hija de 7 años de edad la cual asiste a la escuela de la comunidad donde ella vive, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos se dedica a esta activdad desde hace 4 años, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta ya que se viene la epoca de fin de año entonces es cuendo mas se vende espera que le puedan ayudr con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Ernestina Graciela is part of Dúo Esmeralda. She is a mother, and has a daughter who is seven years old. Her daughter goes to the school in her local community. Ernestina sells cosmetics. She has been selling cosmetics for four years. 

She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics to sell, as the end of the year is approaching and this is when sales are highest. She hopes that you can help with her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's group is comprised of hardworking women. Esther is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past four years, Esther has been working hard to manage her drugstore, which sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used both to acquire more medicine to run Esther's pharmacy better and to help Esther generate greater profits to sustain her family. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her drugstore. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to acquire more medicine to run a pharmacy better.

loans.name: Josehpine

texts.en:
Josehpine is single, 24 years old, and lives in Airport with a six-year-old child who lives at home and attends school.

For the past six years, she has been selling used clothing. She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business. 

She likes her business because she can save money every day. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 23 years old, single, and has no dependents. He sells used clothes and shoes, a business he started three years ago. He earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES. He wants to purchase bales of shoes and clothes to resell; therefore he has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES. 

The profit he makes from his business will help him repay the loan and expand his business. His dream is to own a business empire.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Dorothy Manka'a

texts.en:
Dorothy Manka'a is married and lives with her husband and six children at Bamenda Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. 

This woman has faced so many challenges in life including the death of her sister after lying in the hospital for several months, so that all her money was spent in the hospital.  After her sister's death, she could not provide three square meals to her family.  Thieves also stole her goods in the market,  leaving her with no capital to continue her business. She was sick for several months, and could not pay for her medication due to inadequate finances.

Dorothy Manka'a joined GHAPE in the year 2003, and has taken out and successfully repaid her loans five times. She promises that with the new loan requested, she will buy more food ingredients for her restaurant business like vegetable oil, flour, beans, koki beans, rice, tomatoes, onions and Maggi. She thinks this business will succeed because her business is situated near a school, where students buy from her during breaks.  She sells puff puff, which people buy and eat alongside tea for breakfast.  Her food is in high demand in that locality because of scarcity of restaurants. 

With this business activity, the community members will not travel long distances in search food.  She also educates the community on how to prepare good food so that they can also engage in the business.

With the profit from the loan, she will pay her children's school fees and provide their basic educational needs like text books, pens, pencils and exercise books.  She will also take care of her family's health and plough back into the business.  A GHAPE loan is preferable to her because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and no collateral security before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil, flour, beans, koki beans, rice, tomatoes, onions and Maggi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food-making ingredients, tables and chairs for a restaurant business.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Hajara has been working hard to manage her soft drink business. She sells lemonade and other soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Hajara has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to get more types of drinks to be sold and will help Hajara to generate greater profits so that she can better look after her mother. Hajara hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her income. 

Hajara is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: To get more types of drinks to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 35000 through NWTF to purchase more used clothes to sell to her customers.

NWTF is listing Josephine's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Paxoj Huitan Group

texts.es:
La señora Maura Aracely es madre soltera, tiene 28 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al cuidado y crianza de cerdos, para luego venderlos cuando sean grandes, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su familia y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos y así tener mejor ganancias cuando los venda, espera en el futuro tener cerditos pequeños. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la tejeduría, crianza de animales, y a la atención de una farmacia.
texts.en:
Maura Aracely is 28-year-old single mother. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has four children, two of which are studying. She makes a living taking care of and raising pigs, to later sell them when they are big. She started this business with the support of her family and now has eight years of experience. She has the support of her husband who makes a living from agriculture.

She organized a group to request a loan that she will use to buy pigs, in that way making a better profit when she sells them. She hopes to have piglets in the future. 

The other members of the group make a living from weaving, raising animals and working in a pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install plumbing in the bathroom.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 45 year old widowed woman, who has four children. She is a resident of Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Zenaida plants, harvests, and sells coconuts in order to make a living. With 19 years in this business, each month she earns 29,980 PHP. Zenaida requested for a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She joined GDMPC in 2011 to seek guidance and assistance. 

Positively, she hopes to progress in her business to supplement her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Adankpeji Group

texts.en:
‘Adankpeji’ is a group of three women who are fish sellers. All three women are married; two have children and one has no child. They have been together since 2009 and meet on Thursdays to discuss business.  


Gifty is 38 years old and married to a 48 year old draughtsman called Daniel. They have two children. She is a fish seller and has been taking loans from ID Ghana since 2010. She has been selling fish for 11 years now. She is a very business minded person, who needs finance to operate a mini cold store in her area. Customers in her area have to go about 300 meters to buy fish from the cold store. She wants to explore this business opportunity and make maximum profit.

This is her fifth loan, and she will need financial support of GHS 1,500 to stock her cold store with fish. She has been making a monthly profit of GHS 100, which she invests back into the business.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 4,400 to be able to buy more goods for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.
